Reviews.Title: “Great Location in San Juan Area”
Reviews.Author: KZelenkov
Reviews.Content: We arrived 5 days before our cruise date and wanted to stay in an area with easy access to Old San Juan, the beaches, and rainforest -- with a car. This was a good location for us - just north of the airport, on the beach, good restaurants within walking distance, free parking and easy access to the highways, and shopping nearby (grocery & Walgreens). Be aware that all studios are not the same - price or decor and amenities. There are many owners to rent from depending on the length of stay, etc. -- we found our studio through a recommendation on Trip Advisor - www.esjtowers.net Chana Cohen Vacation Rentals ESJ Towers by Owner - was friendly, had good rates and we stayed in a great unit - Studio #8 with a beautiful view, tile floors. The first night we were disappointed and stayed in a unit that had lots of problems with leaks, dirty tub, sticky doors, outdated decor and appliances and was on the airport side with lots of noise when we left the sliding door open at night - which Chana said they would be fixing. Chana switched us to Studio #8 on the other side of the building overlooking the pool and beach -- no airport noise, tile floors, updated TV and better decor and clean. Friends only stayed for 2 nights and reserved their studio suites through ESJTowers.com - and their rooms had stained carpets, were on the noisy side and had little view. They did get a free breakfast include with their room rate. When you reserve through an individual owner, breakfast is not included and you usually have to pay a $50+ cleaning fee -- so the more nights at the lower room rate the better. ESJ suites vary in price as well as quality, still a great value compared to the other hotels in the area. Right next to El San Juan Resort & Hotel with casino and fancy restaurants. The concierge desk was very helpful. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but Airport Noise”
Reviews.Author: sam1966
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and nicely appointed. The full size refrigerator, stove and cookware were very convenient. Had a great view of the ocean but unfortunately, a good view of the airport and the planes were very noisy. The weather was perfect so we wanted to keep the windows open at night, but by 4:00 a.m. we were woken twice by airplanes taking off and landing. If you closed the balcony and had the air conditioner on, it wasn't that bad. Also, didn't like going through the basement underground parking to get to the beach. There should have been a way to go from the pool to the beach without taking an elevator and going through the parking and out to the beach. The pool was large and great for swimming but closed early. THe staff was very friendly and the area safe to walk at night. Lots of security at the hotel. Very convenient short walk to many nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paula413
Reviews.Content: Never stay at this hotel. There is no dishwasher or maid service. To get fresh towels and linens you must go to the parking garage. This is also where you enter the beach. It's dark and unsafe. The resturant closes at 2:30pm. The rugs in the hall and the rooms are discusting and smelly. No where on the confirmation did it inform you of any of this. The people at the desk where just as bad. I spoke to the owner Mr Katz who also denied being the owner. So what does that tell you. I took me 32 years to return to Puerto Rico never to return again. No room service. The air conditioner was a unit that made noise all night long...

Reviews.Title: “ist time staying @ ESJ”
Reviews.Author: Riveraoldbridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are returning to Puerto Rico. We were there last year and stayed @ the Marriott. I have read the various comments posted and while I'm alittle concerned I won't like my room, I'm keeping an open mind. I called ahead and spoke with Elizabeth @ the front desk. While she said there are no guarantees, she was courteous, very friendly and took down my preferences. I am a time share owner. My husband and I are looking forward to returning. We are very excited. We have stayed at the Intercontinental and thought it was beautiful. The service was fabulous. I hope not be be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “They saved our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: Our original reservation fell through due to our travel agent. The original hotels bell hops pulled out a magazine and called ESJ Towers. The room was old but clean with a beautiful view of the beach. Same price as our original reservation. The view and location was fabulous. Right in the middle of things. Next to the El San Juan Hotel and Casino. We walked the short distance to the ESJ Hotel to listen to the band and watch the dancers.We had dinner at the El San Juan, the Metropol and lunch at the Mexican restaurant nearby. EVERY one was nice. We stayed 2 days and then got on a cruise ship for 7 days. The rain forest was a trip just to kill time before flying home. So much more than a time killer. The ESJ Towers staff personel were not over friendly but everyone was nice. Someone at ESJ towers offered to store our luggage until time to take a taxi to the ship. We enjoyed lunch and walking around the area. I was surprized at how safe I felt. This is our second cruise from San Juan. SO glad we decided to go 2 days early this year. Would love for our adult sons to go with us some time.

Reviews.Title: “A good location, has everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Lives2Dive
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of my timeshare network. The location I found to be great, you can get to and from pretty easy without much trouble. Quick highway access, direct beach access, within easy 10 minutes to airport if not less. The guards are friendly and are there for their guest, you felt safe while staying at ESJ Towers. The rooms could use some updating but have all the essentials, ours had a small kitchen as well if you were looking to cooks a few meals while there. The pool was nice plenty of places to lounge...

Reviews.Title: “Good place for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Rahul A
Reviews.Content: This is a vacation rental, so each room will be different. We did not rent from ESJ directly so it was much much cheaper. The room was ok, pretty basic but the view was excellent. The room was old but clean. We were able to cook 1 meal a day and it had most of the basic amenities like fridge, blender, toaster, microwave, no counter space though. The pool was big and nice with a good section of 3 to 4 ft and equal size 8 ft for adults. The whirlpool was nice and hot. The kiddie pool was there but close to the beach entrance. The towers are on the beach but it is a hassle to get from the pool to the beach; you take elevator to garage, you pass the garage, you take a flight of stairs up and then you pass the children's play area, kiddie pool and entrance to the beach. The lobby is dull but it has these huge sculptures and paintings that make it look unique. There is a mni market which is very convenient and also a Pueblo supermarket 2 blocks from this property.Most of the guards we spoke too were very nice and helpful and there are at least 2 to 3 guards on the property at all times. Parking is free there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach!”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise and it was a nice, older hotel. This hotel suited our needs - it was close to restaurants, had a beautiful beach and offered a complimentary continental breakfast, which was good. We would not hesitate to stay here again - the staff was friendly and the beach was excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here if You Want to be in a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VRPR
Reviews.Content: Strike One: This hotel STINKS-Literally. In the lobby, it's like any other hotel-quiet with nice serene music, etc. However, when we got to our room, it smelled like a musty sour mop and we were stuck with it because there weren't other rooms available. I asked the employees at the front desk if they were aware of this smell on hotel's floor and in the rooms.They said that they were not. I asked if something could be done about it and long story short, spraying air freshner was not an effective solution. The carpet has visible stains in it on every floor & the dank musty smell is in the carpets. The ONLY floor that smelled good was the penthouse floor. The rest of us were on our own. Strike Two: Our laundry got stolen out of their washing facilities (to include underwear) and no one could vouch for what happened. There are no security cameras for your safety in the parking garage-that's where the laundry facilities are-and the front desk clerk said something odd to us like "you are the only ones doing laundry today."When we bought washing tokens from the front desk. You do the math... Strike Three: The coupons that the hotel gives you are not the best recommendations for food or activities. We were expecting to spend money so that was not our issue. We asked for a restaurant with really good Puerto Rican cuisine. The restaurant that is within walking distance from the hotel on the opposite side of the street serves Cuban cuisine. Total disappointment..... Go to Native Sauce & Raices (by Old San Juan) for much better food. Hopefully, you take heed to this posting. This IS NOT A LUXURY HOTEL. If you don't care about the amenities, then this might be for you. However, if you want to have a complete and wonderful relaxing experience, stay somewhere else-like the resort that we went to in Guanica. We came across this location because we were given a week's stay at the ESJ Towers as an anniversary present. This location was chosen because it is very close to the hotel and the beach. Booking reservations here took away from the enjoyable experience as I HATED coming back to this dirty place every night. I did not want to even take a shower in this place. Let alone have sex in a room that smells like a sour mop? If you do, then the ESJ Towers are for you! Everything that we wanted to do was about 45 minutes away. This was not an issue for us as one of the things that we wanted to do was drive around the island. So, driving to a hotel that was not on the beach did not matter because THE ENTIRE ISLAND IS A BEACH and we only needed to have easy access to the airport for two occasions-coming & going.... Highlights of the trip-Doing everything EXCEPT being in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: Joanne F
Reviews.Content: We stay at the ESJ Towers 2 â€“ 5 nights whenever we take a cruise out of San Juan and, for the most part, have been very happy. If you are looking for deluxe accommodations, this is not the place for you. However, if youâ€™re looking for a place on the beach, a pool, wonderful staff â€“ especially at the buffet, free breakfast and a free drink from the bar at night for a fairly reasonable price, look no further. There are also many restaurants and a grocery store within walking distance. The bus to Old San Juan is only $.75. The downside: when you book, you can tell them what youâ€™d like to have (i.e., pool side, upper floor), and they will make a note of it â€“ but no guarantees! Weâ€™ve had OK rooms for the most part, but this year, my sister and her husband had a room on floor 3, overlooking the dumpster, the loading dock for the El San Juan Hotel next door, and the obvious break area for workers â€“ a real disappointment. If it happens to you, just close the curtains and spend as little time in your room as possible! Note that if you are going for a longer period of time, you might consider renting from one of the time-share owners (I've found some on the internet); you can see photos of the unit and you'll know the location.

Reviews.Title: “Condos at ESJ Towers”
Reviews.Author: panarama222
Reviews.Content: We recently rented a three bedroom and two bathroom penthouse condo owned by Chana Cohen, in ESJ Towers. The condo was fully equipped and was impeccably clean, it also had nice views from both of the balconyâ€™s. The bedrooms and bathrooms were large and had plenty of extra bedding. We had read some reviews stating that the facilities were outdated, however, our condos were updated with new appliances, furnitre etc. We were pleased with all aspects of this rental. The location is superb, directly on the beautiful beach and a short drive from both SJU airport and Old San Juan. Chana was helpful and friendly and the fact that she lives on site makes her readily available if needed. The facilities at ESJ Towers were exactly as promised and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub. We will happily rent from Chana again in the future and would highly recommend her rentals to anyone looking for a condo in this area. Please keep in mind that this is a family friendly condo rental NOT a carribean resort.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean. Good location”
Reviews.Author: jimandmar
Reviews.Content: Traveled to visit my wife who was on business. Property has a great location. Staff was very helpful when I needed them. The property is a little dated but is very clean. Very quiet at night. If you are used to some of the larger Carribean resorts this is not the property for you. If you are looking for a nice quiet place to relax this is it. Overall I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “The Land That Time Forgot”
Reviews.Author: Raroach
Reviews.Content: ESJ Towers was built in the mid-1970â€™s and the dÃ©cor has not been updated since. Itâ€™s not bad but it is a little quirky and very quiet. We stayed on a timeshare exchange for one week in a one bedroom. The lobby is dim and mostly deserted. They have a card room and a billiard room that are nearly always empty. There is also a small store with an eclectic assortment of items. But for real shopping, there is a supermarket a few blocks away called Pueblo with everything you may want from a supermarket, open 24-7, and a Walgreens up the street. They also have a restaurant open for breakfast and lunch, which we did not try. Our room was reasonably clean and everything worked. We had a full kitchen with basic cookware and a dishwasher and a washer/dryer. No soap is provided for anything. There is no maid service, not even a mid-week check. To get fresh towels you have to take your old ones down to the fitness center desk in the basement garage and exchange them. They are all counted and accounted for. You can also get soap and Kleenex and TP, but strangely no shampoo. No shampoo for you, two is all you get. I asked why and was just told they have never had it. You can also get beach towels there and rent beach chairs for $2.00, they also have umbrellas and better chairs for rent on the beach for more. The internet access is also outdated. You can pay $12/day for wireless or $0.35/minute at two computers in the lobby. Hotels today should realize that internet access is a basic service and should be free. But if you have an AT&T data plan you will be fine. To get to the beach you have to go through Checkpoint Charlie and register with the guard, who gives you an orange bracelet to identify you. Then you are on the public beach, which is a good beach. There is a ski jet for hire business, along with a group sailboat that can carry group of 8-12 folks. A disc jockey played music from the neighboring El San Juan Resorts & Casino (salsa and enjoyable current hits) and they let me use their bathroom and outdoor shower situated near their pool. (I guess they know where we are from our bracelets). A BBQ grill business offered hot dogs and hamburgers with potato sticks and drinks right there on the beach. It was quite relaxing pleasant and everything you may want at your disposal. Just bring moneyâ€” the food was reasonable. ESJ has an adequate pool and hot tub. Unfortunately, it closes at 6 PM. Thatâ€™s right, itâ€™s lights out and everybody out of the pool at 6. The only activity we saw poolside was Bingo. The average age of the members and guests here is senior with few younger, no children were seen. Thatâ€™s the theme here, dim, dated, quiet and set in its ways. The staff was polite and helpful. Some of them have been here for many years and I did detect a slight undercurrent of guest-itis, that condition of long-time service workers who start to think that if it werenâ€™t for the damned guests, their job would be sweet. We had a car and guest parking is on the very bowels of the underground garage and no charge for parking. We were invited to a little time-share welcome party at the â€œHappy Appleâ€�, their little reception place. The drinks and food were good and surprisingly there is virtually no sales pressure here. The Isla Verde location is very good. It is next to the El San Juan Towers, a real resort and casino that is absolutely unrelated. When our GPS said we had arrived, we turned in there but were told to go to the next little street where there is a guard shack. They have a lot of security. In brief, this is not a bad place to stay and is a good base of operations for exploring the San Juan area. They have a concierge that is there all the time. If you just want to hang out at the pool or the beach that works here as well. It is quiet and relaxing and meets all basic needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just not nice people”
Reviews.Author: RFC411
Reviews.Content: I have to say the staff for the most part over all is poor but in the Casino just down right rude. If your not a local person they would rather you not be there. With that said the restaurant's are fantastic but I will never go back because the attitude of the people is they don't like you ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kath5181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ESJ Towers in February of 2009 with our two children through our timeshare. It was nice, affordable and within walking distance to restaurants and the market to get food for the kitchen that we had in our room. We had an ocean view room which was very nice but the planes taking off nearby took some getting use to. The pool was great and the kids had fun playing bingo every afternoon by the it. The breakfast at the hotel was quite pricey the first morning so we only did that once. We even took the public bus to old San Juan to tour the forts. It was only a 20 minute ride. We did rent a car to see the rainforest which is a must. Being right on the beach was a great addition. All in all it's a nice affordable place to stay while visiting San Juan and taking in all the sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give it a 5 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: 67Cadillac
Reviews.Content: Trust me, I've stayed in some $400.00 and up a night hotels and had no expectations like that upon comming here, but lets just say the best thing this place has going on is it's location. The ESJ Towers is a condo that literally sits in the shadow, or on the same property as the larger El San Juan Casino and resort next door. Get it (the names)? El San Juan?..... ESJ Towers? If these two properties are affiliated, then the ESJ Towers is the 70's version of its resort-big brother next door. I mean, they boast how the ESJ Towers has been in operation since 1975 but everything in the place still says 1975: the furniture, the carpet, the lobby set up, and I'm not kidding-the smell. Now I'm used to timesharing and have come to realize that some of these places have full-time residents, this you can tell by some of the front doors to the units and where they have the "guest" park down in the lowest part of the subterranean garage (seperate from the residents). They must try and keep the light bill low by only using the bare minimal lighting throughout the place as looking down the hallway on my floor was like peering down an alley at night on Bourbon Street in the French quarter: dim. The carpet on all the floors smelled like they had'nt been cleaned in years and I've slept on better beds at Holiday Inns. I had to Pay $12.00/day for AT&T WIFI internet service (thanks for the "Hot Spot") and you couldn't close the bathroom door after you've sat down on the toilet (a lack of foresight on the remodelers part, I guess). But hey, it was just me and the wife and we were burning a week we had banked last year, so it was free, I guess. Would I stay there again? Sure, I got used to the occasional plane landing at the airport just a few bocks away and hey, your right on the beach in downtown (the tourist section) San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach access.”
Reviews.Author: hash_ram
Reviews.Content: We loved the super easy beach access from esj towers. The lobby looks shady but the 2 bed 2 bath condo we stayed was nice. The restaurant and bar are also shady and terrible food. Good place to stay if you just want to chill out on the beach. I am going to try the condado area next time for access to good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, & Place”
Reviews.Author: dcikon2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ESJ from December 24-29. This was our 3rd stay at ESJ Towers. I must say this is one of our favorite places to stay in the Caribbean. You cannot go wrong with staying at this place, especially when considering the cost of other places in Isla Verde that are located directly on the beach. Though you are provided nightly free drink coupons to use at their bar, we did not use them this time. I liked getting up in the morning for the buffet breakfast and to talk to their staff. The staff in the restaurant are extremely friendly. I really liked the banana muffins, waffles, and bacon/sausage. There is also a game room, computer room, small gym, and store on site. Pueblo grocery store is a short walk. The beds are comfortable and bathrooms large. My only suggestion would be for the hotel to purchase new towels for the beach. The white towels that are checked out for the beach are too small for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ppny
Reviews.Content: This was once a wonderful resort. Now it is horrible. It is dark, dirty and worn down. Most of the staff at the front desk are extremely rude. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Towers - great location but the property is stuck in a time-warp”
Reviews.Author: foxhillOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed as ESJ Towers six times. We have a studio (two double beds) unit on one of the upper floors that overlooks the pool and the ocean. The first time we arrived at ESJ, we didn't know what to expect. We found the lobby and many of the common areas to be old and dark and definitely not as nice as most hotels where we normally stay. That being said, our room has always been clean and the staff are always friendly and very quick to respond to any problems we had. The view from our balcony is nothing less than spectacular. Yes, ESJ Towers is dated but so what? The location is fantastic, the beaches wonderful (except for the unavoidable seaweed that creeps in most mornings!), the area is safe and the food delicious.We plan to return for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location but outdated facility !”
Reviews.Author: tx_pearland
Reviews.Content: The building is pretty old, lobby is dark, but it's in a very good location. Right on a beautiful beach with very swimble water. Wendy's, Subway, Burger Kings, Chili's, Walgreen and super market just steps away. It has Ping Pong, convenient store, small Arcade, card\pool table in lobby area, daily bingo at pool area. Gym is very small\dark, Sauna is only open 3 hrs\daily - not clean. We ( 2 adults + 8yr) rent a efficiency from VRBO with 2 double beds and full kitchen. Ate at Koco in El San Juan on ThxGiving night --- very good. Ate lunch at MetroPol by Hampton Inn -- very good just like other review, just portion is too big :) as well as Jose XXX Bar and Grill ( 2 door down to Lupil) -- best for the food and price.

Reviews.Title: “The ESJ”
Reviews.Author: Lucas C
Reviews.Content: The ESJ Towers is a good hotel to stay in if you are visiting Puerto Rico. The lobby is really cool and has a card room, a billiards room and even a computer room. It also has a room for your kids to play in. The Pool is HUGE!!! I don't like the rooms thought. But who cares about the room if the lobby is nice!

Reviews.Title: “Better than you expect”
Reviews.Author: Travelismyforte
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in early October at ESJ and found the resort to be very clean, the whole staff very helpful and the location just fine for our stay. We were on the ninth floor with a partial view of the Atlantic from our balcony. Our one bedroom was good size and updated. The facility has a small store, a little pricey, there is a coffee shop and a small pleasant sports bar. Near by there are many good restaurants and some inexpensive ones too. The bus to Old Town is cheap, but does take some time.(75 cents, exact change only). We got a roll of quarters from the bank. The pool and the beach are great. We would happily go back again. Take the trip to Bacardi yourselves. The bus to the depot, the boat across, eat at the restaurant across from the boat pier and then the bus/taxi to Bacardi. The reverse back to ESJ.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, crappy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Roketeer
Reviews.Content: Had bugs in the room, really overpriced for the quality of the room. The gym is 3 trsdmills, a stair climber and a set of dumbbells with 3benches.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, OLD, Roches”
Reviews.Author: Veronica P
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I have ever had, right from the entrance, its dark gloomy, the staff doesn't do anything to make you feel at home. They don't greet you, and they act as if your not welcomed. The Hallways are dark and smelly, the carpet looks dirty, the rooms are dirty, sofas are dirty, the rooms are not cleaned very well. The Lobby is hot and dark and smelly. I will never come here again, and in one of my family members room there were roches in the fridge, they told him to stay in the room while they sprayed some inscet sprey. very very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.....”
Reviews.Author: Sugarnspice2002
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for? For the time of the year we came to visit (worried about hurricane season) it was definitely a surprise. My friends and I decided to do a get-away during low season. To me we came out on top. We rented from a lovely family (Chana ). Everything here was very convient and reasonable. I personally rented from other owners before and yet none of them made me feel as if I was welcomed or at home. For me and my drunk rads the 15th floor was a gorgeous site. The condo was very neat and yes simple but all the neccessities were at hand. So anyone who placed a negative comment : well lets just say maybe you need to spend your time on Condado beach or Old San Juan with ridiculous prices. Otherwise my only negativity will be the 7pm curfew of the pool and beach. I personally love to swim in the pool at night when the tides at the beach are too high. So on this round I never had the chance to swim @ the pool but the beach all you have to do walk on the public street to go the entrance of the beach. Again we loved this trip and the easy convience of restraunts, bars, clubs, and family attraction . Everything was pretty close to being perfect. I loved this visit and Yes the next round I will have my restless bunch of family and friends with me .... Thank You Again Chana <3 Love Allen Lee McGhee

Reviews.Title: “Old Moldy Hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: We did an Interval getaway with the ESJ Hotel Sept 2011. The place is dark and dingy even in the middle of the day. We were extremely disappointed this hotel did not meet the Interval standards by any means. The rooms were clean and staff friendly but the place is very very old and moldy. We left after 2 days out of our 8 days stay. The a/c has to be kept at 60 (freezing) degrees or else the walls, floor and ceiling became so wet it is disgusting and funky smelling. Hotel needs to be upgraded because it is at a great location. Next to the resort casino, great resturants, near the airport and next to one of the best night clubs on the island. ESJ is in the middle of the island but located in the Carolina not even in San Juan as the name implies. The a/c was so loud we stayed awake most of the night because of the loud a/c on the tiny balcony overlooking the top of the apartment bldg across the street. If you are not the Super 8 Motel type then you will hate the dingy moldy place.

Reviews.Title: “Will not staying at the ESJ Towers”
Reviews.Author: SAW466
Reviews.Content: I really hate to be critical of the ESJ Towers, but really, the place needs to be upgraded. The room we had on the sixth floor, well, what can I say. It seemed to be moist in the room all the time and there was a smell that I cannot describe. It went away when you turned the air conditioner on. Needless to say I don't think we will be going back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Lillian S
Reviews.Content: Great staff, security very good, beach and pool area clean and private excellent for family with small children. Good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Studio 1657 - Another great experience”
Reviews.Author: PR_Lovers
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at ESJ Towers and we were not disappointed. For us, it is important the condition of the unit we rent and not so much the hotel lobby or hallways. That is why we rented through Gilda Fisher of Regal Caribbean Properties again because we knew exactly which unit we were renting. This unit has been remodeled and upgraded with many amenities and the view is spectacular. They now offer online reservations on their website which is very convenient. Always ask before renting a private unit if and when it was updated. so you are not disappointed when you get there. We'll rent this unit again for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - Rented from Chana Cohen Never again”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel7564
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the ESJ towers in various units. But this one was the worst of all. The view was amazing and the room was clean. However it is outdated and they were very cheap about the amount of towels and sheets. The tub would fill up top of the tub and even though we called to have it fixed it still occured. The room needs definitely needs maintainance. Its ashame because this hotel is located in a "Prime location" on the beautiful beach of Isla Verde. Chana is a very pleasant woman, but until those units are brought up to par I doubt I will be staying there again renting out one of her units. Its nice to save money, but its not worth all the workarounds when you are trying to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at ESJ”
Reviews.Author: ksharp
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked ESJ through our timeshare company Interval International. I was skeptical based on previous reviews, but remained open to see what ESJ had to offer. ESJ was a wonderful place for us to enjoy our summer vacation. Yes, the hotel is a bit older, but our suite was clean, the staff was friendly and knowledgeable and we had no problems accessing the beautiful beach. Yes, you have to walk through the parking garage and wear a wrist band, but not a big deal. The beach is beautiful, the view from the balcony was awesome. The pool closes early which turned out to be a blessing b.c it allowed for quite time in the evenings. We even went on the timeshare tour and were not pressured a bit. The restaurant is lacking, but there are several others within walking distance. Wifi is $15 per day, go to a restaurant and pay for drinks instead and enjoy their free wifi. ESJ was great, would go back there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't expect too much... you might be alright.”
Reviews.Author: FourBeavers
Reviews.Content: If you've read through the other reviews, you know, this place is dated. It looks exactly like a movie set from a swinging 70's era film. It is old, worn, and not well lit. However, if you take it in context, it is not that bad. It is on an island in the Caribbean, of course some paint will be peeling, there will be water stains, etc. This is rather shocking at first, but after a day we were used to it. We spent 2 weeks at ESJ towers, and we lived to tell about it. I agree with previous posters, the location is wonderful. It is right on the beach, close to the highway, and close to food & entertainment. The parking is underground, so your car can cool down fast in this wicked tropical heat. We did notice that the way you are treated depends on how you came to stay at ESJ. We were staying someone's timeshare, and while the staff was polite and helpful, they were not in a hurry to make our stay comfortable. It took 4 hours to get a roll-a-way bed that we asked for a month in advance. We asked for more shampoo and were told 'no.' But, we felt safe the entire time, took advantage of the beach, and tried to roll with the punches and make our stay at ESJ Towers as pleasant as possible. Our biggest complaint: the beach access & pool close at 7pm. I have never in my life heard of a beach hotel that closed their beach access, but this is ESJ. We did notice that as a whole, everything on the island of PR closes insanely early. I also hate it in this day & age when a hotel does not offer free internet. Internet at ESJ will cost you $12.95 for each 24-hour block.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: Pollytorr
Reviews.Content: Our family went with my sisters family who has stayed at ESJ Towers in the past. We rented privately thru Chana Cohen and stayed in units 1469 & 1174. The unit my family had originally booked was not available and Chana "upgraded" us to unit #1469 (if this was an upgrade I would hate to see the other unit) . Both units were clean but in desperate need of updating, walls were cracked and ceiling & wall paint chipped. The air conditioner compresser units were on the balcony and threw off so much heat it was impossible to sit out there without shutting the complete unit off. Our unit had no shades or enough curtain to cover the window, the sun is so strong that it made the unit hot and the bright morning light made it impossible to sleep. Supplies were very limited, only 2 rolls toilet tissue for 4 people for the week. My sisters unit had a leak in the bathroom and left a message for Chana which she never returned.(she lives in the building) The halls and lobby of the ESJ Towers are not air conditioner and were exteremly hot and antiquated. I will say the building staff were very friendly, and the building is in a good location with many chain and local restaurants within walking distance. Beach chairs are rented at the cost of $4.00 per chair per day which can be very costly. Fortunately we didn't spend much time in the units and had a wonderful time despite the accommodations. The cost was reasonable, but you do get what you pay for. Our next trip to Puerto Rico will not be spent at the ESJ Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for location/price”
Reviews.Author: jchurich
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that used to be part of El San Juan a Waldorf Astoria property. Not it is run as it's own hotel with some rooms having private ownership. It's lobby, elevators, and aesthetics are like walking into three decades ago but for the price it is a perfect location in the Isla Verde area. Isla verde is right next to the airport so being from CA we assumed it was not a great spot but it is in fact one of the most tourist-friendly areas in PR. ESJ is right on the beach they have great security and the rooms have kitchenettes and balconys (hard to get a bad view). The pool is not resort-like or rather lacks the resort feel but when it's hot it does the trick- mind you it closes at 7 and the El San Juan next door is 24hrs. It is near shopping and food and American restaurants. I would recommend going to more local food fare but if you want Chilis it is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, very out dated.”
Reviews.Author: edmunds13
Reviews.Content: We were offered by a family member to stay at the ESJ Towers because they couldn't make the trip and would lose their week for the timeshare. We were very excited to go but a little apprehensive about staying here because of the reviews we had seen. The reviews were spot on, the facility is really outdated and our room was in need of some TLC. Our washing machine overflowed 3 times, and the garbage disposal didn't work. So maintenance had to come to our room twice. Because it appears to be so old I got the feeling that it was very dingy and didn't really want to snuggle into the couch, (when i could bring myself to sit on it) it may not bother some people but I was skeeved out by all of the furniture. The pool area was decent and the beach is pretty close. Getting to the pool isn't too difficult but you do need to pass through the parking garage, it's not as bad as some people made it seem, I thought. Despite the condition of the hotel it proved to be in a very convenient location. There was a Pueblo grocery store within walking distance and very close to a few other restaurants like Mi Casita, where we went a few times, (good mofongo). We were slightly disappointed when we explored some of the surrounding hotels, they seemed to be much nicer, but again our accommodations were paid for so we couldn't complain. If I could suggest to anyone considering ESJ Towers you may want to shop around before committing, if it's priced comparable to other places I would try those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: MelodyKL
Reviews.Content: This is a place next to a great place to stay! El San Juan Hotel is right next door and is a great place to stay with a great pool and a great bar and great food. On the other hand ESJ Towers was outdated, old, dungy, gloomy etc... Nothing Carribean about this place. Thankfully we had friends at ElSan Juan Hotel where we spent most of our time and just came back to sleep and shower!

Reviews.Title: “Same old Same old.”
Reviews.Author: autigers5252
Reviews.Content: Back in Puerto Rico on business and stayed at our contracted lodging for this location. The ESJ Towers is in dire need of a renovation. Everything in the hotel is dated. The decor is like something from a 60s film. The staff is pleasant and helpful but the pool area and the guest rooms are dilapidated.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE AT ESJ TOWER”
Reviews.Author: LizzyArizona
Reviews.Content: Many summers my family stayed at the hotel when i was a little girl.After many years i was looking forward to revive my memories and start a tradition with my niece and nephew .At check in, my niece wanted a high fllor ..we were denied. The lady claim it was the only room available(555)...I told her i'm a light sleeper she insisted it was quiet. All lies ....our balcony was in front of the back door entrance of the other hotel..We had noise all nights until 4am..It was horrible...I wanted to park a 2nd car insidethe property for 2 hours becuase my mother in law was coming to visit in her weelchair...after waiting for 20 minutes for a supervisor nobody showed up and the request was denied.....i need it fresh towels. i called housekeeping and was told to walk to the fitness center.I was in shock. I had travel 62 countries and was never told to walk for towels....A long walk to the basement but i did it. I followed their instructions. ..When I went there the employee asked me for my other towels. I told him i left it at the room ..He said without the other towels he was not able to rpovided new towels.I requested a manager....then the general manager showed up as a coincidence ...with the same bad attitude as the employee. i explained to him that i had called and follow the instructions ..to walk to the fitness center to get new towels but i was never told to bring the dirty towels. He gave me a speech like a little girl...What a rude and nasty man....His name is Luis...I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THAT HORRIBLE PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: pipeoli
Reviews.Content: If you are spoiled by the luxury of the Grand Mayan, Grand Bliss, and the all-inclusive Palace Premier resorts (5- and 6-star resorts), then you are in for quite a shock when you enter ESJ Towers at San Juan, Puerto Rico. Unless you are able to make immediate, effective changes, simply, take a deep breath and make the best out of your current situation. Letting anxiety get the best of you will certainly derail your vacation in the Island of Enchantment. Puerto Rico is a beautiful place with lots to offer; but you must be in the right mind set to enjoy it to the fullest. We do not own a time share and do not know who Interval might be (records at ESJ Towers indicated Interval for our reservations). We are members of the Grand Bliss (Mayan Group) and through the GB; we obtained reservations through our membership with HSI. However, ESJ Towers classified us as timeshare owners and rendered us ineligible for maid services. But that was not a problem with us because we can be flexible and can adapt on a momentâ€™s notice. We can make up a bed and we could get the necessary articles for the room by just walking to level B-1 any time within operating hours. My wife and I were on a 21-day vacation that included the Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, and Florida. Our reservations at the ESJ Towers were sort of odd. We booked two weeks in a Studio unit at ESJ Towers 19-26 May and May 27 through June 3. We accepted those terms. Because of previous commitments at the Dominican Republic we arrived on May 21 and again, because of commitments in Florida we departed on June 2. Although we arrived two days late and departed one day early; the ESJ Towers was unwilling to let us stay on the 26th of May and avoid a break in our two reservations without purchasing a 1-night stay. So conceivably, ESJ Towers rented the three nights that we did not use. We chose to find accommodations elsewhere for that one night in the same area. The Hilton family of hotels came to our rescue for the night. We had read several reviews of ESJ Towers ranging from 1-star to even up to 4-stars; and some people at trip advisor dare to rate it higher. I would rate the entire facility perhaps at the 1.5 or 2-star levels. Definitely ESJ Towers is not better than that. But what do I know? Now, the staff, security, parking, laundry facility, and on site store are superb. The facility and units are aged and the furnishings need updating. Maintenance of the facility in terms of decor and repairs is lacking. Perhaps, removing the carpets and installing tiles throughout the facility would probably make the place smell much better. The air is musty at times and uncomfortable to a degree; but it is not unhealthful and your body will get used to it after a day or so. We stayed at a studio unit on the 6th floor nearest the El San Juan Hotel and Casino (south end). The unit was located at the closest point to the loading and unloading dock of the casino. The noise level emanating from the dock and the loud music from the next door casino were unbearable and running very late at night. It was not easy to get a good night sleep in that studio unit. The second week, we requested to be moved to a room as far from the next door casino as possible. Again, we got the 6th floor across the hall and nearest the elevator (about one third of the hall from the south end). We no longer heard the noise from the dock or the music from the casino. Better noise level but a bit worse unit. Both studio units we occupied (and, if Iâ€™m not mistaken, probably all units) feature an air conditioning unit that sits on the balcony. That alone, renders the balcony useless because of the heat emanating from the AC unit. Of course, you can turn off the AC while you are at the balcony; but you should not have to do that. A little thought in the design would have eliminated that problem. Overall, we enjoy our vacation because we were out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do it... GROSS”
Reviews.Author: VintageChick
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was for 2 weeks here at ESJ. I was extremely disappointed with the whole experience here. The property is in a prime location, however it is not being maintained. Their focus is on low cost, and because of that, the quality of the resort is severely lacking. We have owned at various locations for over 25 years and of all the places we have been, I would rank this one as the least satisfying of all of them. The decor of the lobby, bar and restaurant at ESJ Towers is stuck in the 70's. They do not seem to be interested in upgrading the decor at all. The room we occupied was severely lacking in cleanliness and decor. The bathroom has black mold around the shower and tub area and the bathtub is cracked by the drain. The shower curtain has mold on it and when I asked repeatedly if we could have a new shower curtain I was told that no, we were in a timeshare unit and that was not covered or available. When I asked a maid if I could have another roll of toilet paper I was told she was not supposed to give me one, but I had to go to the front desk to get one. She gave me one anyway, but only after I had gone to the front desk and asked for one and was told to get it from housekeeping. When we checked in we were told we would get maid service after 1 week. We asked for it at the one week mark and were told we did not get maid service and that if we wanted it, it would be a 35$ charge. After 6 phone calls and finally talking to the the manager, we were given maid service begrudgingly and one day late. It was ridiculous having to go through all of that. The locks for the rooms was another huge issue for us. To get the slider key to work, you had to sit there and run the card up and down over 10 times. We complained over and over about this and all they did was to reprogram the existing keys.There were a couple of times that they gave us "new" keys, which upon observing how they do the new keys was disconcerting. They reuse the old keys that are turned in and do not use brand new un-programmed keys to make new ones. The location of our unit was less than desirable. We faced the driveway and were subject to listening to delivery trucks and taxi calls at all hours. We also faced a housing development where we had a less than lovely view of a sea of air conditioning units on top of roofs and the less than delightful sound of 3 dogs that would not shut up. From the balcony of the unit we could see a sliver of the Atlantic ocean over the top of the AC sea. Paint is peeling on the ceiling in the unit as well as on the balcony. There are also cracks in the exterior wall on the balcony. Stock plastic chairs of the Wa-lmart variety are what we have on the balcony to sit on. Everything seems to be of the cheap variety as far as furnishings. We head home tomorrow and I will be glad to be leaving this place. We will not return to ESJ Towers and would NEVER recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but needs improvements in other areas...”
Reviews.Author: Telecommie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and if it was not for tripadvisor, I probably would not have gotten a room with a view on the upper floors as per other reviewers. Do ask for a QUIET room with a VIEW, preferably on the upper floors (above 8) and in the odd numbered rooms. I was on the 12th floor and the view was priceless, unfortunately, this ends the good news for ESJ. The room definitely needed an update (it looked old), the TV was ok, really small and NO DVD Player, the kitchen was quite small, no dish washing liquid or even a dish washer, the fridge door handle was broken, you would think they would repair it before giving the room out? NO FREE INTERNET; they want $13 a day or $70 a week, go to Burger King on the strip where they offer FREE INTERNET. The convienince store is nice but the prices are quite high as is the buffet at $13.50 a person for breakfast - definitely not worth it. Go to Mi Casita a couple of blocks away (WEST) for great Spanish food. The beach is fantastic as long as you wait for the seaweed to be cleaned in the morning, the private entrance should stay open longer as it closes at 7PM, maybe another hour would be nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I did not have any insect issues as mentioned by another reviewer staying there at the same time I was. I found it strange that the AC unit was on the balcony, the balcony doors are quite old and could not hide the AC compressor noise turning on or off constantly, they could not find a better location for this? The King size bed was in excellent condition as were the pillows, the bathroom really is dated too and an update is in need.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: MISSY8278
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented three hotel rooms from ESJ Towers. Two of the rooms where OK! I would say that they could be cleaner but given the price not terrible. However, my family staying in the third room I rented has a very big problem with roaches and we actually saw that they were coming from the room next door. We told the front desk and showed them pictures. They did not offer to change the room. ON check out day we went down stairs again to complain and talk to a manager because we had spotted another roach. The manager went on to call her a liar and really did not do much to compensate for the horrible experience or service. Please think about it you do not want to go through what we went through there.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelerGEO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks. The place was built in the mid 70's and it has not done much sense then. The location is one of the best in San Juan, close to the airport and right on the beach. The staff goes out of there way to make you feel at home. The rooms are dated but clean. The room are somewhat strangely decorated with no one room the same. There are some rooms that are time shares that have metal gates on the doors so that is strange. I would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: dorismbes
Reviews.Content: ESJ Towers is the greatest place to stay in Puerto Rico!!! Chana was a great hostess, and her condo that we stayed at was in a great location and was true to the website pictures. The condo was overlooking the beach and it was great to hear the waves of the ocean 24-7. I have been to Puerto Rico before, and I can honestly say that this is the place to be and stay. So close to the airport and so many great restaurants that are all within walking distance from ESJ Towers. We rented a car and there is free parking in the garage below at ESJ but not needed because taxis are readily available and for a cheap price. El San Juan hotel and casino is right next door for your pleasure and also has a Starbucks to get your morning fix. The beach area is great and you can walk for miles. I was up every am before 6 am to walk the beach and then it felt like the day lasted forever. (sad to say I have a hard time to get up that early at home for work but knowing that the beach and sunshine await, you do not to waste any time there in PR) What can I say except I am already planning my next trip for next year to Chana's place @ ESJ Towers. Doris

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we exptected - Rented through Gilda Fisher”
Reviews.Author: Norma_exp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never visited San Juan and were a little apprehensive about choosing a property on our own without knowing the area. The condo at ESJ seemed like a great value for the money. Once we arrived in San Juan at the property, we found the accommodations to be wonderful, clean, and all staff members we met were just fantastic. Everything was in walking distance and the beach access was close and easy. We had not one single disappointment to report. I want to thank Gilda for making the reservation process really easy and everyone at ESJ for making our stay so enjoyable.. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Self Service Hotel With No Charm To Make Up For It...”
Reviews.Author: ejpavlacka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ESJ Towers for one week on a timeshare exchange. I had read the most recent reviews of the hotel on this site and they were generally positive. Well since coming back I've been reading the bad reviews and I'd have to say those are the truth. Check in went smoothly enough, but when we saw the room it was the beginning of a downward turn that continued throughout the stay. Our safe and a light in the room were broken...I called to complain, was told there would be someone from mainenance up shortly. No one ever came. Well unless you count several days later when maintenance staff showed up and said the people below us were complaining of a water leak, so they came in and out of the room for the next 45 minutes to repeatedly flush our toilet. As previously stated in some of the reviews, you have to walk through the stuffy, humid garage to get to the gym, where you'll be visiting often...Not to work out but to request everything from towels to toilet paper to garbage bags. If the rooms were nicer or there was more to do I could let the fact that the hotel does nothing to treat you as a guest slide. But since they have no positive contact with you it just kills your mood on your trip. And then on top of all that, we apparently had bed bugs. I didn't initially realize what these mysterious bites were, until I counted the bites on my legs and feet and they numbered over 80! Now while the hotel does have some nicer rooms than the studios timeshare guests are given, there are many other hotels on Isla Verde that don't require you to be your own maid, walk through a parking garage to get to the beach access with Fort Knox like security and assigned hours (if you plan on staying on the beach past 7PM enjoy the 7 block walk around to the hotel entrance), terrible restaurant, no activities, no free wi-fi, ...Really, stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Esj is a wonderful beachfront hotel , so close to the airport. the prices was reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: 4tiguero
Reviews.Content: Esj towers was so conveniently located to the airport and the casinos. We wish we had more time to spend on beach, it was so special being able to walk with our family on the beach. Next time we will stay longer at esj towers. We had a really fun time. the beach was just beautiful and the water was warm.

Reviews.Title: “After many years of returning, Chana never fails to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: dkgraft7
Reviews.Content: I have been renting from Chana for many yrs...I have never, ever had 1 complaint...Just came back from vacation & can still hold true to my statement...Chana does her vey best to accomodate all requests....We were staying for 2 weeks & requested an oceanview/pool view....It wasnt available when we arrived but Chana went out of her way & after 2 days we were moved the room of our choice with the best view available on the 15th floor...bed was great, kitchen & bathroom were clean....had a little trouble with access cards, though, didnt work at all times...We had our daily walk along beach which was beautiful..We were going to rent a car but seeing its so close to airport & public transportation was only 75 cents into Old San Juan, we never bothered...We had a studio & Pueblo's was right around the corner so it was very convenient to shop there & cook in room & not have to eat out every meal...we made breakfast every a.m. & ate on balcony...What a great way to start the day. The way the room was situated we were able to open patio doors & lie on opposite end of bed & watch the ocean...There was no need to get to pool early for chairs..The pool is huge with plenty of loungers....Bingo is played daily at 2pm & although I frowned at the idea there were so many people playing the pots were fairly large & found myself playing also, for the 1st time in my life, lol...If ur a gambler, plenty of casinos in area...El San Juan Hotel is the best which is right next door..Its part of the Waldorf/Astoria so needless to say "very classy"..Walgreens is also couple blocks away which we found ourselves frequently visiting....All in all I would greatly recommend ESJ through Chana Cohen & cant wait to go back again next March....

Reviews.Title: “Great place!! Thank you Chana!!”
Reviews.Author: shannamarie13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ESJ March 6-13 in a studio and thought it was perfect! Food and night life are all within walking distance, the beach is right outside the door, and the pool is great as well. We LOVED the beach and front door staff!!!! I've read some of the negative reviews and have to disagree. My room was clean and comfortable. We washed our dishes prior to using them and had no issues. I am very picky about my hotel stays; I normally only stay at 5 star hotels, and this was just fine for me : ) Is it the Ritz? No. It is a comfortable, affordable option for those that don't require being waited on hand and foot. We would love to return to Puerto Rico, and if we do, we will definitely use Chana and one of her properties again!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay at ESJ”
Reviews.Author: nanatee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a one-week stay at the ESJ. I have to say, that we had very few complaints. The condo we stayed in had been renovated so there was newer tile, furniture, appliances and a flat screen tv. The living area was open and airy with 2 sofas and a small table. There was also an area for meals and a small kitchen with most of what you needed. The bathroom was okay. The shower curtain hooks kept falling off the rod, the water pressure was low and the drain was partly clogged. That was the real drawback to the place. We really liked having a washer/dryer and did several loads while there. You can hang your non-dryables in the large, walk-in closet and they are dry by the next day. If you don't like noise, this may not be the building/condo for you. The airport is very close so you can hear the jets frequently fly by. Also, the a/c unit is very loud both inside next to the dining table and on the balcony. We weren't there most of the time, so we could tolerate it. The bedroom was quite spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was very squeaky however, and the pillows were lumpy. Again, something you could tolerate for just a week. Maybe not for a longer stay! The facilities of the building were easy to access. The pool area was nice and easily accessible and you were given 2 towels each time. Getting to the beach wasn;t so bad- you had to go through the underground garage- the fitness center handed out towels for the beach. Using the security cards was a bit of a pain but I guess there is a need. The lobby is outdated, as everyone says. My husband and I were thinking it would make sense to move the little mini market to a space in the lobby as there is a lot of wasted space. We liked that you could use computers but you had to pay by credit card. One of the hotels best features is the concierge desk. We had Jasmin and Tina book many excursions for us and they gave us good recommendations for transportation, meals etc. They provided us with excellent service! It is also wonderful having the security at the front of the building because they call you a cab when needed. The location of the hotel was very convenient. there were many restaurants, clubs, a pharmacy, grocery store and bus stops nearby. It was great to shop at Pueblo for breakfast and lunch items. Overall, I would recommend this unit to others. We had a very pleasant stay and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay - Thank you Gilda”
Reviews.Author: HB1962
Reviews.Content: My stay at ESJ Towers was awesome! I decided to try something different and book my vacation stay at ESJ reasons were I have friends that stay there and they say it's so pleasant there. Also, I was traveling with 4 kids and my cousin and I wanted them to have a nice place to stay in. The idea of having the amenities that they had was so convenient. The kids loved the billiard room, video game room and especially the huge pool. Staff was very pleasant. Gilda Fisher was also very helpful and very prompt with communicating with me as well! I like to thank everyone for making my stay at ESJ memorable! The kids want to go back again as well as I. I will definitely go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place for the $$”
Reviews.Author: Foxboro2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the ESJ towers and had a great time. We are experienced travelers and having been to San Juan before knew exactly what to expect. The hotel/timeshare is a clean decent facility that is very outdated but still fine. As others have stated, the location and staff are excellent. The pool area is also very nice, much better than you would find at your typical 2.5 star property. Our hotel room was fine, it had a king bed and a nice balcony with pool and partial ocean views (Room 365). While the hotel is dated, it really is in decent shape. The included breakfast was pretty good, as were the daily free drinks at the pool bar. The crowd is a mix of hotel guests, timeshare owners and their families. My only real issue with this property is that all the security procedures can be a pain in the butt. You have to use your room key to access the pool and you need to get a bracelet if you want to sit on the beach and re-enter the property. While all of the security personnel are very nice and professional, I am not sure why they are all needed? The area seems very safe and nice with a lot of families and retirees around. The pool is open from 9:00am to 7:00pm and then it is locked up, a little strange for a resort destination. Last time we were in San Juan, we stayed in Condado which I thought had more to do than Isla Verde. As far as food is concerned, we had only one great meal which was at Platos. We also ate at Metropol which I thought was just o.k. and Lupis which truly was the worst food food as I ever had in my life. The EL San Juan Hotel next door has a great rooftop bar and restaurant with incredible views and a fun casual atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoe_324
Reviews.Content: Our stay at ESJ was awful. The place feels dirty, since the bathroom has not been renovated since it was built in the 70s. Everything feels dingy - carpet, sheets, etc. Yes, there is a full kitchen, but since everything feels so dirty we did not even touch anything there. It's a pity, becuase the staff is very helpful and the location is fantastic. But we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at ESJ Towers was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: matthewnorman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at ESJ Towers in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico and it was one of the best parts of my trip. For less than the price of a hotel in the area I was able to stay here in a fully furnished 1 bedroom apartment. The location couldn't be any better for both families and people like myself who were just there on the island to get away from everything the cold northeast had to offer. I rented from Chana Cohen, who lives in the tower as well, about 6 floors down from the apartment I rented (the 15th). The space was comfortable with full kitchen (utensils, pots, pans & dishware provided), dishwasher, washer & dryer unit, pullout sofa, two TVs (one in the living room, one in the bedroom), the bedroom was also large with a HUGE walk in closet where there was a cote just in case I had any extra extra visitors. As I mentioned the area is great, the locals are nice and it feels quite safe. There are plenty of restaurants and activities located within walking distance of ESJ Towers - Chilis, Outback Steakhouse, A Fantastic Taco Bar, and a little local gem called Ceviche House. Not to mention the fact that there are multiple casinos just as close. There is a grocery store located just a few blocks away so I was able to save up on cash and cook in-house whenever I wanted. Isla Verde is close to pretty much everything the first time PR Visitior would walk. We rode the bus to Old San Juan (cost 75 cents each way) and didn't feel any sort of danger EVER. And while we had to rent a car to get to El Yunque, it was only about 45 minutes away, and a very nice ride. Going to Culebra was also just a a matter of driving to the western side of the island (about an hour and 15 minutes) and getting on the ferry (get there early it tends to sell out fast). So the location was spot on. ESJ is literally ON the beach. About 6 minutes from the airport- costs 10 dollars and a buck a bag via taxie to an from ESJ. The beach, pool, spa, and gym are all gated so you don't have to worry about your safety. Renting from Chana meant I was provided with a parking spot in the on site garage which is also located IN the building, so it was a HUGE plus when I rented a car (walked about 10 minutes to enterprise). While I didn't have a car, I was able to use the bus, but if that's not an option for you, ESJ has many Security persons on premise, at least 2 posted in front of the lobby who will be happy to call a taxie for you (they park at and next to ESJ)- they take about 2-5 minutes to get there. Chana was fantastic, as was her husband, they greeted me and helped me settle in quickly. There is nothing better I can say about the both of them.

Reviews.Title: “One month stay at esj towers”
Reviews.Author: terrywelsh
Reviews.Content: I had some trepitation about the hotel. Then I came to my senses. The hotel is very livable. King size bed great view of the beach. Simple room do I care if the hallways and llobby are a bit tacky? No I'm spending time on the beac h pool and going to the more upscale hotels for entertainment the location is perfect. Restaursant walgreens within easy walking distance. The bus takes you to old san juan for 75 cents. Its safe for a woman traveling alone. The staff is helpful. Getting to the beach via the garage is not attractive but yoou get used to it. You're spending time on a great bea h not spending time in th garage silly. The min mart in the lobby is a life saver for whatever you need right away. The rooms are not chic but the view is great. New mattress you can sign up with Att for wifi 29 per month. I'm content and saved a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “We left this dump of a hotel with bites all over our body”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_Lover_24
Reviews.Content: We were bumped off a flight recently and were put up at this hotel for one night. Even though we did not pay anything for the hotel, it was still not worth it. The hotel was built in 1975 and has not been renovated since. One side of it faces local streets where kids party until late in the morning and you can hear everything through the very thin sliding glass door. Also you hear the airplanes taking off as if you were at the airport. As if that is not bad enough, we got bites all over our body from the dirty rooms with bugs in this hotel. We had previously stayed 5 days at a nice hotel down the road and not a single bite, but one night at this dump and we are now suffering all week. Unless you cannot afford anything nicer, you should seriously stay away from this property. The miserable, dark lobby is no better than the dark hallways and old uncomfortable furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Value!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckMike
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent central beach front location in Isla Verde area. Many chain restaurants, local restaurants & casinos just outside the front door. 24 hour supermarket (Pueblo) and drug store (Walgreens) just 1 1/2 blokcs away. The hotel lobby is a bit 1970's but since we didn't spend alot of time sitting in the lobby it did not effect our enjoyment of the resort. Studio Room: Our studio room was very comfortable with a kitchen including coffe maker, toaster, microwave, all pots, pans, dishes etc, and a full size fridge with built in ice maker (very handy). Room had a huge closet, dining table , flat screen TV and all the regular furnishing you would find in any hotel. The towels are a little rough, but we survived. As we were hotel guests (not timeshare) so we received maid service daily. She even did our dishes everyday. One complaint you see over and over again is that the air conditioning unit is located on the balcony. Yes, it's a bit of a nuisance when you are on the balcony (noisy), but can be shut off to enjoy a quiter balcony experince. Smoking policy: The entire resort (inside & outside) is non-smoking. Smoking is only permited on balconies and an ashtray is provided. Food & Beverage: Happy Apple Restaurant is open for breakfast & lunch only. Our rate included a full American buffet breakfast. Good variety of food, however it is basically the same everyday. It is up to you to decide whether to have eggs today & waffles tomorrow. If you want to have it all everyday you may get bored of the selection. If you want something not on the buffet (like 2 eggs over easy) just ask and it will made fresh for you free of charge. Service was excellent! We did not have lunch at the restaurant. The bar "Mano-A-Mano" is alittle overpriced and the service was terrible most of the time. The resort did however provide us with a few free cocktails. Other Services: The Fitness Center is small, but does have a fairly good variety of equipment. I never had to wait as it was never crowed. Seperate mens & womens saunas are operational between 5-7pm daily. Beach chairs can be rented at the fitness center for $2 and they are yours for the whole day. You can return them to go shoping & pick them back up in the afternoon for more beach time if you like. Towels are also available free of charge for the beach as well as at the pool. The pool deck has a huge amount of available loungers. A guest laudnry is available for your use. A wash or dry is $2 & tokens are purchased from the front desk. Resort Fee/Internet: As of June 2010 the $10 Resort Fee is no longer charged to hotel guests. This only affects Wi-Fi Service. It is no longer included and if you wish internet access it is 12.98 a day thru AT&T. Weekly packages are available. The reosrt does have 2 computers in the business center where you can access the internet for 35 cents a minute. Miscellaneous: Prior to our trip I read many comments regarding "having to walk through a dark parkade to get to the beach" ~ it is true the fitness center is located in the parkade & so is the beach access door, but it is far from a dark, scary place. If you use the North Tower elevators, you are just steps away from the access door. While this resort is by no means a "Hilton", it was very comfortable, the service was great and the resort takes great care with security to ensure only those who should be there, are there. I would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room on the beach”
Reviews.Author: proptravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost two weeks. The ESJ is a older Hotel but is clean and the staff are very helpful. Great location on the beach and very close to the Airport. The pool is nice and there are other higher end hotels very close by with casinos, nightlife and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “THE TRUTH ABOUT ESJ”
Reviews.Author: saragrealtor123
Reviews.Content: ESJ TOWERS is very dated because management tries to keep cost down. The hotel next door el san juan hotel( same beach) 2 min walk from esj is charging $400 plus taxes, etc.per night for christmas season. ESJ location is perfect, right on the beach, yes you have to walk thru garage to get to beach, it has been set up like this for saftey reason, the pool is much cleaner than the el san hotel next door. The building has hotel rooms and times shares, also private apartment owners that own and rent units as well via homeaway, etc. . Some apts are renovated and some of the are not. Chana Cohen owns and manages several units in the buidling, some of her units are renovated and some of them are not depending on the owner and the unit in questions. The location is perfect, restauraunts, casinos, night clubs, cabs right in front of building 24/7, staff at front desk very helpfull, the restauraunt in the building is not five star but the food is ok, the bar is quiet and the bartenders are very friendly, the store in the building is perfect , it has all basic necessites, such as milk, snacks, wine and liquir and other essentials. The gym is small but perfect for a quick workout. esj is charging for wi-fi try finding a rental with free in room wi-fi from private owners if you decide to rent via private owners. We found prbeachrentals.com they specialize in renvoated units at the esj towers, no roaches, everything new bathrooms, furniture, flat screen tv's, new linen and towels. Very clean units. What I like about the location was the beach, easy acess to old san juan, rain forest and other day trips. The EL San Juan Hotels rocks friday & saturdays, starbucks, great restuaraunts, to much to list. Again, if you get a renvoated unit, you will be more than happy and will return year after year, if you rent a old unit that has not been renovated you will you not be happy and will encounter many of the stories below. Make sure you are getting newer unit from anyone you rent from at the building. I hope this review is helpfull to all. It seems as if there are negative reviews about the ESJ TOWERS that are not accurate. If you find rent a great unit, please post it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!”
Reviews.Author: dclisme
Reviews.Content: We rented from Chana Cohen and it was one of the best experiences of our lives. The place was really nice and she provided all the essential amenities we needed for that week (i.e. bath towels, laundry, etc). The location was also GREAT! Anytime we needed to eat or go to the beach, it was right outside. Also, the people at the front desk were really helpful when we wanted to go to other places of San Juan. Overall it was one of the best places. Lastly, the value was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: amygeorgemarx
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay with young children. Small kitchen in the room made it easy to make breakfast and snacks, large supermarket within short walking distance. Beautiful view and close to a lot of inexpensive and child friendly restaurants. A beautiful beach, fun play ground and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hardygirl52
Reviews.Content: This property is located right on the beach which was fantastic. I am a beach lover. Chana was very instrumental in having everything ready for us when we got there. Even gave us a free upgrade which we were very excited about. Great location or restaurants and other entertainment. We would diffenitely rent fron Chana again. Very pleasant person.Only 8-10miles from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: glblackjeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sept 25 - Oct 2, 2010. We picked this hotel due to the convenience of their kitchen facility and larger rooms. The staff was friendly, very courteous and helpful. The room was quite clean & ready upon our arrival. We stayed in the North Tower on the 6th floor. We had partial view of the ocean, as well as a balcony. The hotel was located on the beach which was great and they had various water sports for rental right there. They also rented lounge chairs for $2 for the day. This was really helpful since we visited various beaches (Luquillo, Patillas, etc) during our stay there. The pool was huge and had a nice setup. There was also a billiards room, card room & bar located in the lobby. The location was great since it was not too far from getting on the major highways to get to various tourist sites. Different restaurants as well as 2 different Walgreen's were within walking distance, which was a big plus. Although we rented a car, we took a bus to to see El Morro fortress and to spend time in Old San Juan for the day. The bus stop was no more than a block or two from hotel. The only thing I did not like about this hotel was the small restaurant they had in the lobby. It did not offer much of a food selection and we felt it was overpriced for what they had to offer. Also, on our 2nd day the headboard on top of my bed fell and upon complaining to management, they offered to change our room. Since we had so much of our stuff set up already in the room, we opted instead for free internet access for the remainder of our stay. All in all, this was a great vacation at a great hotel in a great location. I would definitely recommend ESJ Towers/Hotel as a place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: bwia2002
Reviews.Content: I loved the attractions in puerto rico. My family can't wait too go back. I went to the history of the bible museum it is like a mini amusement park for kids there is activity for adults too. One thing I love with puerto rico the people are extremely friendly they go out of their way to answer questions and give directions etc. I love puerto rico.

Reviews.Title: “I won't even stay there for free”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl46696
Reviews.Content: family member owns timeshare, they gave us a week for free. this hotel is old.smelly.dirty,and nasty. I would rather stay at the inter continental. The only good thing here is a pina colada and bingo poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate timeshare at right price, but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: LarryGross
Reviews.Content: Went in early September 2010 as a timeshare swap through Interval International. (The hotel & casino and the time share units are separate, adjoining buildings. The timeshare unit was about the size of a large hotel room and was listed as an efficiency. It was clean and well-maintained, although somewhat spartan. The kitchen is tiny (no counterspace and a small-footprint stove&oven), so while cooking for yourself is possible, it's also challenging. There's a large foodstore about 3 blocks away (Pueblo Foodstore, not SuperMax). This is not a luxury accommodation, and doesn't even really compare to other high-end timeshares that I've seen (like many of the Marriott properties). On the other hand, the facility is right on the beach. It was clean, comfortable and functional. Staff was generally very helpful, and there's lots of security at the facility. The fitness center sucks, but you can rent beach chairs there cheaper than you can rent them on the beach itself (and you only need to carry them 50 yards to the beach). The hotel is on the Isla Verde hotel strip, two doors away from the luxury Intercontinental Resort & Casino, (which is also home of the $14 hamburger). It's extremely close to the airport (taxi was a fixed rate $10, so don't let them charge you more). It's only 10-15 minutes from Old San Juan and other areas of interest, and a good staging point for excursions around the island. For example, we took a ferry to the outlying island of Vieques. We drove our rental car from the hotel to the ferry in Fajardo in about 50 min., and that was during morning rush hour, I would not hesitate to stay again at El San Juan Towers (known as ESJ), however, if you've come to expect a high-end timeshare, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE ROOMS and really BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: XXTRISHXX
Reviews.Content: We live on the Island of Puerto Rico, 30 minutes from the ESJ Towers.
