Our air conditioner broke and we needed to find a place to stay at 2:30am, we called the ESJ Towers and the clerk told us, "We have plenty of rooms available, we also have plenty of ocean view rooms available". We got there, I am handicapped and they had NOT ONE HANDICAPPED PARKING AVAILABLE!!! I was told I could park the car in the "No Parking" spot and walk in the rain to the hotel and they would make sure it wasn't towed away (is it even legal to have no handicapped parking?). I made my way to the front desk, asked the clerk for an ocean view room, he said he had one on the third floor, he advised me of the no smoking policy and I had to sign a paper that the entire hotel is no smoking (not a problem as I don't smoke), I paid and proceeded to go to my room. I opened the door to the smell of cat urine, gagging, I made my way to the balcony and noticed we were not in an ocean view room, the only "view" we had was of the dumpsters from the back of a different building, the smell was atrocious! I called the front desk and told them it wasn't an ocean view room, he told me they have no ocean view rooms, they are saved for guests that they want to sell a timeshare to, since we had been here before and did not buy the crimeshare, then we were not allowed to stay in the better rooms. I advised him that my Aunt wanted me to take pictures of the hotel and the view so that when she visits me she will have an idea of what type of place it is, and if I take pictures of this room and the "view" then she will never stay at this hotel. I told him that it reeks of cat urine and there are cigarette BURNS in the comforter, if this is a non smoking hotel why are there cigarette burns where I have to sleep? I asked him to please put us in the room I paid for and he told me, "When you called I had rooms for 40 people, but then I sold them all before you got here", I told him, "When I checked in, you said you were putting me in an ocean view room, and it wasn't a problem, this is not ocean view and it smells really bad", he told me, "I sold all 40 rooms before you got here", I told him, "It took me 30 MINUTES to get here, you mean to tell me you sold 40 people rooms in 30 MINUTES? And why did you tell me that you are putting me on the third floor ocean view?" His reply, "I thought you meant that view", I asked him "are you honestly telling me you thought "dumpster view" means "ocean view"?? I then asked to speak to the manager, Tobias I think his name was, got on the phone, I explained the situation and that I was lied to and he told me, "I got here at 11pm and there were ONLY TWO ROOMS available, your room and one other, we sold the other room", I told him "Someone is lying, because we called at 2:30am and was told there are plenty of rooms, we drove out here, it's 3am and now you are telling me that when you got here there was just two rooms available, but your desk clerk tells me there are 40 rooms available...who is lying to me, and WHY? I was planning on taking pictures of the hotel for my Aunt, she has been wanting to come here and wants pictures of various hotels in the area, he tells me, "We have a room set up for pictures, it is a room we don't book, but we have it set up to look good for timeshare people, but we never book it, if you want to take pictures I will let you in that room but only for pictures" I explained to him that my Aunt does NOT want a staged room, she wants to see the actual place, and if I take pictures of this room and tell her it reeks of cat urine she and her friends will NEVER STAY HERE! The manager continued to lie, and I asked him why are there cigarette burns all over my comforter, does he really expect me to sleep in a room for $189 with the stench of cat urine and burnt up old blankets? The MANAGER then put the CLERK on the phone, so I told the clerk I want my money back we are leaving and never coming back. He told me come down, we don't care. I went to the front desk and the manager saw me and quickly ran out of the window and hide in the back room, never once apologized or anything. This hotel is not worth your time or your money! If you want a REALLY nice hotel, look up the El San Juan Hotel and Casino, yes, they are affiliated with the ESJ Towers, but it is built newer and they take the time to make it smell and look great. The price online is very expensive, but if you call the hotel directly and make a reservation you can get it for the same price as the ESJ Towers or cheaper!!! The ESJ Towers used to be a great place to go, but since they decided to sell to timeshares, they went downhill, it really is a dump, the rooms smell like a dump, the view they give you is really bad, unless you never stayed there, then you will get one of their ocean view rooms and they will try to sell you the timeshare. By the way, I marked "value" in rating this hotel as a two instead of a one, because when we did stay there years ago, we got the ocean view and it was one of the cheaper hotels in the area, and the beach is GREAT. So if it is your first time staying and you get the ocean view it's a good value, but if you don't buy the timeshare, I would suggest you don't go back because the way they treat you is really bad, and now in today's economy the better hotels are the same price, I would highly recommend the El San Juan Hotel and Casino! NOT THE ESJ TOWERS!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: taty7919
Reviews.Content: We also used ESJ as a timeshare exchange. This place needs major renovations. AC unit is in the room, very noisy. Place was dirty esp. the bathroom. i had to buy cleaning agents to clean myself after making a complaint. I was so disguisted at the place. Hallways are very hot no air, would never stay there again. Sorry. FYI ,Beware of bed bugs

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DDHAuburn_AL
Reviews.Content: We did not realize how fortunate we were to stay in such an excellent resort until we got to the airport and heard others' horror stories! The ESJ Towers was a wonderful resort. Even during the Category 4 Hurricane Earl, their main concern was for our safety and enjoyment. We were never without power. The generator kept everything running as normal.Restaurant, bar and store remained open throughout the storm. Each room had a balcony and each balcony had steel shutters that we easy to close when needed. Many who stayed at newer and fancier did not have this kind of experience. For example: sitting in the lobby for 3 day eating only popcorn. We were so impressed with the security and friendliness of the entire staff. Anything we needed was not a problem. Can't wait to go back to this beautiful resort and beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Disgusting, Roach Motel (literally)”
Reviews.Author: LadyPWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as advertised. It is terrible! I had to have exterminaters come to the room twice to exterminate. There were roaches crawling on the outside of my room close to the door one day. Two days later there was a roach on the inside on the door. I did not have any food in my room that would have attracted them. There is no decent restaurant in the hotel and the store, it seems as if the items were just thrown on the shelves and one only wonders how long they have been sitting on said shelf. The sheets on the beds were so thin one could actually see across the room through them. For $149.00 a night one expect something better. Spend your hard earn money somewhere else. ESJ Towers is the worst.

Reviews.Title: “If you have traveled extensively, do not stay at ESJ...”
Reviews.Author: CJLO10
Reviews.Content: I returned last night after a week at ESJ and my head is still reeling. My family has a time share at ESJ for almost 30 years and each stay is a disappointment. I had to pay next year's maintenance to use an extra week this year. I requested a handicap room for my elderly mother and was told repeatedly that there were one bedroom handicap units. No, all handicap units are studios. Then I was told that handicap bathroom equipment would be made available for the one bedroom unit. An excellent maintenance staff member bought a shower head because low and behold, they didn't have that either. We packed less clothing due to the airline's fees for luggage and we know there was a washer/dryer in the unit. Well the washer flooded the room twice, creating a musty stench and a safety hazzard. Tufts of human hair were floating around the room even though our room was suppsoedly cleaned thoroughly twice (no cleaning provided by ESJ time share). I will probably stay there again because we own the time share and the ESJ's proximity to family and the location is great. But I honestly would never stay there again. It's ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Mortalsby
Reviews.Content: Have been there over50 times; always a delight; bottom floors do tend to be a bit "musty" but that is because they wash the walkways ever morning and until it dries....well....get over it. It is a bit "dated" as far as "decor" is concerned, but in my 50 visits, always new paint, carpet, draperies, in rooms; Best thing is full kitchen; you don't have to worry where your next cup of coffee is coming from; bring back left overs and stir them up; don't have to keep your milk in an ice bucket; Say hi to hotel manager, Lewis, desk manager, Pablo, conciege, Tina, and desk people, Lettie, Jesus, et. al; in the mini mart, George, and Santiage, ; in the bar , Marco Nikki, and Erik; in the outside kiosk, Carlos. Be nice and you can get whatever you want; be humble and let the "ugly americans" go to el conquistador and the Marriots." sheesh; Come to ESj and have a great time!!!!!!! M

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: raul3365
Reviews.Content: This was the best experience in a hotel of my life, the service was great and Chana Cohen the administrator was perfect, i can not wait to february when iam staing again and in july of next year i will do it again, it was just great.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Demallo
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Puerto Rico with a group of friends and I have to admit we had a fantastic time. We went there for the Salsa congress and rented an Apartment at ESJ tower from Chana Cohen.I have to say special thanks to her because she did everything to make us feel welcome. The apartment was very good just what we were looking for, the rooms were simple, clean and of a nice size with plenty of storage space. The Location was excellent not only for the congress which was only next door El San Juan Hotel Casino where the Congress was taking place but also close enough to all the bars & restaurants in Isla Verde. We had a direct access to the beach; the Swimming pool was also very good. Overall, we had a brilliant time in our apartment in ESJ towers. I would recommend it to all travellers no matter what time of the year and it is the ideal place for Salseros going to there for the Salsa Congress in July you really couldnâ€™t ask for anything better for after party. Guess what? We had such a good time that we all started saving again for next year and believe me next time we will stay there for 3 weeks minimum Marcel

Reviews.Title: “ESJ is Great???”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelScoop
Reviews.Content: It's a budget hotel that is OK...but if you are use to vacationing and expect the accomodations and common areas to be modern, relaxing, inviting and beautiful you will be dissapointed. The Hotel - you are first greeted by the heat in the lobby. It is dark - probably to keep the heat down since there is no air conditioning in the public areas. That includes the lobby, elevator and hallways. The decor is depressing - had a flashback to the 70's. It is decorated the same as it was when the building was erected. The Rooms - My first room was on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. When I exited the elevator you smell dampness, heat and food. It reminded me of the projects - except the projects have insulation so you don't smell food in the hallway! The room was just as bad - old appliances, dirty carpet, run down furniture and you could see clear under the door into the hall...was just waiting for roaches to come visit in the night. I didn't see any though! The bath and kitchen were clean but everything was so OLD. Moved to another room on 7th floor - b/c of the smell of smoke. The 7th floor room (King - city view) was much better - updated with modern appliances in kitchen, but the arm chair was visibly dirty and soiled. Bathroom was used when I checked in and it appeared that the bed was used - but the manager told me they just don't iron the sheets? The toilet broke - but then again it was an old school toilet with hardware from the 70s or 80s. The toilet and tub are separate and in a tiny space - if you are big you will have to leave the door open. Maybe if you step into the tub, then close the door. The Location - typically when you stay at a "beachfront" property it is expected that beyond the back exits of the hotel is the pool area and then the beach. The layout at ESJ has the pool maybe 3 stories up from the beach - to get to the beach you have to go down into the garage basement - walk a distance - stop in an office to get towels, then head to the first security door, to be greeted by yet another security gate with a guard. (that closes at 7pm) Then you may exit to the beach. It was a hassle. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. GO TO Mi Casita. Not much to do except hang out at El San Hotel - this is the premiere nightlife spot in Isla Verde - ran into a few celebrities. It is right next door. The Beach - it is a nice beach, but for beach lovers who are use to the more expansive beaches off the Florida Gulf Coast or East - you will want more. The beach has a small strip of sand and can easily get crowded. Hardly enough room for frolicking. The view includes run down abandoned buildings and other hotels. Luquillo Beach is gorgeous and I hear Flamenco Beach may be the best in all the Caribbean. They have umbrellas for $10 - chairs for $3-5 bucks. Amenities - They charge $12.95 for internet access! It has to say it is included in your rate for it to be free. They do have a computer room for use @ 35c per minute - but the internet connection is pitiful and a complete waste of time. I complained - one desk clerk gave me a crumpled AT&T piece of paper and told me to call them. Excuse me - you provide the service - don't you care how it is working??? Breakfast was OK. It is served in a cafeteria style room - also dark but with TVs. Customer Service - the manager and staff may seem to be accommodating - truthfully I feel their only goal is to not be rude. Which is not bad - but I am often greeted with a smile and by my name when I check into nicer chain hotels. If you have to wait in line while 5 staff members have a conversation and ignore you until they finish - it means to me customers do not come first. Just don't have any problems, don't hassle them and things will be fine for you. On the otherhand - the people who are nice are just genuinely nice people and naturally can't help themselves - not too many of them though. Summary - If you expect beautiful accommodations when staying at a beachfront hotel - you will be SORELY disappointed. However, if you are a family/group on a budget and want to be close to the beach as much as possible and need to cook a few meals - I can see how some would think this is great. But how do get over the dark halls, smells and 1970s lobby and hassle getting to the beach??? Also - perhaps the higher floors with an ocean view are renovated?? But my bathtub was lined with shiny linoleum - from 1970. Not worth $150 per night!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: mrsCami
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a joke! It looked and smelled like a convalescent home at entry no AC in the lobby, which was ridiculous given the humidity. The linen was like a crumby motel. Laundry service was extra which wasn't offered to us until day 6 of complaining. We had to walk our laundry to the basement through a carport. U couldn't order any additional cable channels, only basic cable. The funky coffee maker,toaster, and iron weren't worth touching. The AC unit on the balcony was so loud and blew hot air into the room, through the balcony door! The hotel staff was nice but misinformed us on things/info. We had to go out and buy dish liquid to wash our dishes because our unit had no dishwasher and the hotel didn't provide any. The hotel restaurant had a buffet with like 5 or 6 items on it an had the nerves to charge $13 pp. I just couldn't believe it. I could go on...DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: sinarzink
Reviews.Content: The ESJ towers were very nice. I felt very safe. The beach was beautiful and somewhat secluded. The drinks are outstanding in price as well as the food. We found a great food stand right next to the hotel selling burgers and such. We ate there twice. We went to Old San Juan twice and bar hopped. We had a blast. ESJ towers are convienently located next to everything. If you leave ESJ towers and go straight and it does a dog leg to the right you will find a big supermarket. That worked out well, we bought our alcohol and some food. Everyone was really nice and we would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, better than expected. Right on the Beach.”
Reviews.Author: TonyRo
Reviews.Content: I had read alot of reviews of ESJ towers before we got there. I was a little concerned by a couple of them. I am here to tell you that this hotel is great. We encountered no issues stated in other reviews about running out of hot water and such. Hotel room was clean and organized. Staff was great. Hotel is close to alot. I recommend taking the bus if you want to visit Old San Juan. The bus cost 75 cents each and you take it to the terminal (last stop). Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. 2 casinos within a block. I suggest Momoyama restaurant. great food, good entertainment (food cooked in front of you). Best thing I can say about our trip is you get out of it what you put into it. We enjoyed Puerto Rico and the hotel was more than adequate. Enjoy yourself and make the most of the local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: chrisso99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome..... in 1975 when it was built which is the last time they bought carpet, towels, and bed linens. The staff is very friendly and the pool is decent and not over crowded (because the hotel isn't over crowded). That's about the only thing to go in the Pro column. The hotel is right in the middle of Isla Verde and the beach is OK. Just ok. If you want a truly nice beach worth flying for hours to get to you'll have to travel to other parts of the Island. The nice section of San Juan is Old San Juan which is a $30 cab ride or a 40 minute each way bus ride. The hotel smells old and requires a lot of maintenance so forget trying to nap during the day. There is almost always some sort of work going on during the day and it's vicinity to the airport means constant loud airplane noise until late in the evening. Its sad that this hotel is letting itself go but until the ownership realizes that a major gutting and refurbishment of nearly everything is necessary, it's going to continue a long not so slow decline into seediness even the drunkest Spring Break revelers will want to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Towers made a big comeback”
Reviews.Author: Conch
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews about ESJ Towers, both pro and con, we decided to go ahead and book our timeshare exchange there through DAElive.com. (By the way, we stopped using RCI and Interval International years ago after discovering DAE. For less money and much better service, we have always done well with DAE, and never had a bad exchange). Our room at ESJ Towers (1573) must have had a recent makeover, because the furnishings, amenities, etc., we all new and comfortable. We were on the west side of the building, away from the airport, so it was quiet with a great view of the beach. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and answer any questions. We visited the pool and beach several times during our stay. Never tried the Happy Apple restaurant off the lobby, since there were so many other excellent places nearby. The balcony was nice, but whoever decided to install air conditioner compressor units on those small balconies should be pushed off a balcony! Everytime the AC compressor turned on you had to either turn off the AC or go inside to get away from the roar. Terrible design! As previously reported, the Towers provide a lot of security, which they must feel is needed, although we never saw or heard about any problems. The room safe was large enough to hold our laptop, so we were happy with that. The local neighborhood is urban, and probably not a great place to go for an evening stroll. But in the daytime it felt pretty secure to us. We rented a car from Hertz (no problems at all, a week's worth of gas cost us only $25!). The driving in Puerto Rico (both in the city of San Juan and on the winding, narrow mountain roads) was harrowing, to say the least. These roads are definitely not for the faint of heart! But we survived, and visited Old Town, Fort Morro, the rainforest, and the observatory at Arecibo. Didn't drive all the way around the island as planned; decided to stay at the resort a couple of times to recover from the roads! Did I mention the lack of signs (others have in their reviews)? Road signs are optional all over PR, so you never know where you really are or what road you are turning onto. Sometimes you just have to be lucky. One staffer at the observatory advised me to get a GPS unit, although I'm not sure how well a GPS would work there. Probably a good investment. The observatory at Arecibo was a little disappointing. No guided tours, just a movie that they show you. The staff isn't very technical, so I couldn't get answers to many of my questions (I used to work at the Kennedy Space Center and consider myself a "space junkie".) At the rainforest we paid three bucks for a guide, who had an advanced degree in horticulture. My wife is a serious gardener, and found the walk to be quite informative and interesting. Well worth it. The underground "dungeon" garage at ESJ Towers is not a fun place. But we always managed to find a parking spot and avoid hitting any of the poor pedestrians who try to walk along the narrow driving lanes to get to the pool or their cars. One big surprise at ESJ Towers was the lack of any timeshare sales pressure. We saw people sitting at an unmarked lobby desk who looked like timeshare salespeople, but none ever spoke to us and we received no calls, not even a brochure. The lobby concierge was also very helpful but never suggested that we spend a dime on a tour or anything else. I liked that! We found the Pueblo supermarket down a side street across from the ESJ Towers, behind the Chilis restaurant. Good place to buy a deli lunch or some of those delicious PR breakfast rolls. But for dinner we went out every night to one of the excellent restaurants. These included the Parrot Club in Old Town San Juan (good), and Koco, Alfredos and Brother Jimmy's BBQ at the El San Juan Hotel next door and Lupis Mexican restaurant on the other side of the ESJ Towers. All of those restaurants (all a very short walk away) were most excellent, with outstanding food and service. Even the BBQ was better than most stateside places we've been to. Nightlife is a big deal to us, and although we didn't explore the city looking for locals hangouts as we usually do (driving and parking conditions were prohibitive), we discovered nightly salsa bands playing in the huge lobby of the El San Juan Hotel next door. This is a place where the locals dress up and watch the crazy tourists, and the tourists go there to watch the locals show off their best moves. We always sat at the largest lobby bar with a good view of the dance floor and the band, satisfying our craving for nightlife. Prices were a bit stiff, but service and entertainment were worth it. There is a casino at the hotel, but it takes your money and gives little in return. Guess that's all I can think of. We may post some photos or a video in the near future, but so far haven't worked on the ones we took there. Would we go back to Puerto Rico? Probably not, because there are so many other nice islands in the Caribbean with less congestion. We are heading to St. Lucia in July -- looking forward to that!

Reviews.Title: “This is an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkatcape
Reviews.Content: We did this as a time share exchange. This is an old hotel that needs to be upgraded! One elevator out of service during the stay a second for a period of stay. Linens and towels are low quality and very thin from age. Pool towels are small and "scatchy" Rooms do not have matching lamps etc. There is a $10.90 surcharge/tax per day. Fitness Center has outdated equipment and some do not register info at all Restaurant on site is poor. Better to go to local spots like Mi Casita, Metropol for good food and reasonable rates. Highly recommend Dragonfly in Old San Juan - try the Peking Duck! Local bus to Old San Juan only 75 cents. The staff are wonderful and do their best to accomodate your needs, Tina at the conceierge desk met all our needs for travel around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingkate01
Reviews.Content: We did a time share exchange. The we had a studio on the eighth floor which was spacious and the view was great. Beach is beautiful although the first day there was a lot of seaweed; but it was cleaned up the next day and seaweed free the rest of the week. Got a good rate on a car rental from the hotel as we rented a car for one day to do own tour of the island. We also got a great food restaurant recommendation from one of the staff. Only complaint was since we were so close to the airport, the noise of the planes landing and taking off was annoying..but all the hotels on this strip of beach would have the same problem. It was not constantly all day long just in certain periods.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Gatsby456
Reviews.Content: Two of my friends and myself just got back from Puerto Rico. We stayed at the ESJ Towers and would come back again anytime! The cab ride from the airport was about 10 mins, the hotel is right on the beach (which is beautiful!!!!) the room we had was large and included a small kitchen which we made dinner and breakfast in a few times. Pots, pans, silverware, dishes and glasses were all provided free of charge. If you plan on staying a while don't forget dishsoap at the grocery store, which is about 3 blocks away and has a great selection of everything you are used to from home. The pool was spectacular, it is surrounded by palm trees and a calm breeze. Don't miss Bingo everyday at 2:00, and the pool side bar is the best! There is a laundry facility in the lower level which makes things much easier when staying for more than a few days. The staff was great, anything we needed they responded to immediately. We had a problem with hot water the first day and within 5 mins it was fixed, same goes for the safe in our room, the staff came up right away, even though we had closed the door and jammed something in the side. Old San Juan is about 10-15 minutes away by cab and the bars and restuarants nearby were great. We can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A week of relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Tburke126
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the ESJ Towers. We rented a one bedroom condo from Chana Cohen and the room was excellent. The hotel in conveniently located close to everything in Isla Verde, the beach is beautiful and the views from the rooms are gorgeous. The renting of our room was very convenient and hassle free. All the employees at the hotel are very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BNCNewYork
Reviews.Content: Hi, my girlfriends and I stayed in Suite #1657 for a long weekend. It was perfect! The studio was very spacious, comfortable and with an AMAZING VIEW! The property is very safe, Security is great. Overall staff, very hospitable!! I had the priviledge in communicating with Gilda Negron, who was a pleasure! Looking forward to my next trip there (hopefully soon)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: spinobil
Reviews.Content: ESJ Towers offers good size rooms, not luxurious but functional and has all you need for a comfortable stay. All looking a little dated but well maintained and the location is great. Found the staff all very helpful and willing. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Isla Verde !”
Reviews.Author: Viajera048
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Puerto Rico and now that my family no longer has a property in the island, it has become necessary to book hotels for my visits. After a bad experience with a hotel in the Condado area, I decided to give ESJ towers a chance for a 2 night stay. The first thing that scored high points was the fact that they have a free parking garage with security. It has become common practice in PR to charge an arm and a leg for parking at hotels that are already quite expensive. So this was excellent. You go straight from the garage into the elevators to your apartment. They gave me a large studio with two queen size beds, and a kitchenette . The bathroom was huge with double sinks and the shower even had a stainless steel retractable clothes line. I was lucky enough to get a breathtaking view of the ocean and the Isla Verde skyline through the large sliding door. The balcony of the unit was quite large and had plenty of space to sit and walk around. You also get private access to the beach with a key.I just wished my husband had been there with me but it was a quick trip to see my dad. Definitely a safe place for a woman traveling alone. It is an older property and as soon as you walk into the lobby you can get a feel from the seventies but it is kept in tip top shape. It' only 5 minutes from the airport and you can leave your car parked in the garage and walk to any store or restaurant in just minutes. If you are planning a visit to PR and want to forgo the complications of a hotel with parking charges and inflated prices, you will not regret staying a the ESJ Towers. It is worth the price- without any headaches or aggravations.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: adventurehunterx2
Reviews.Content: The property is in a location that's convenient to shopping, restaurants and, most importantly, the beach. I was a bit disappointed that the hotel's beach access and pool both close at sundown. You can still get to and from the beach through the public access, but you have to walk a few blocks down the street. The housekeeping staff was not terribly motivated to take care of our room and the room was also very outdated. I believe the entire hotel could use a makeover. We had a problem with the loud air conditioner on the balcony right by the bed. It made it a little difficult to sleep. I also didn't enjoy the paper thin walls. We could hear our neighbors flush their toilets and run the shower. Hot water is also an issue. The water turned cold after just a few minutes. Overall, I really enjoyed my trip to Puerto Rico...maybe because I spent most of my time away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps I was misinformed about what to expect from PR?”
Reviews.Author: apple-tron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the reason my trip to PR was not what we had hoped for. So outdated, it smelled bad, it was depressing. There was nothing to see around it either and the souvenir shops had all Made in China stuff. The food around the hotel was not very good either and extremely expensive. I can't complain about the food because I like strong flavors and probably someone else might find it delicious. I did expect Sea Food places to abound but this was not the case . I came back from my trip and hit my town's local fish market and stuffed my face. I do want to visit San Juan again at another hotel just to make sure my accommodations were at fault and not the city. I did not get to enjoy the nightlife, perhaps next time I go my experience will be different.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: underwriter_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are ESJ vacation club members. We stay at ESJ 2 weeks in May and 2 weeks in Dec , we stay in the same room/unit every year. We have been vacation club members since 2003 (we have a lifetime membership). Although, we love Puerto Rico and ESJ's location, the room cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. The rooms have a pissy smell, the chairs in the rooms are filthy, the mirrors and glass sliding doors, glass on the pictures on the walls are dirty. The carpet needs cleaning. We had to purchase a bottle of Fabreeze fabric spray in order to freshen our room. Friends of ours came down and stayed with us at ESJ in Dec 09, they had the same problem with the pissy smell in the room. And the chair in their room was also filthy. I brought this to the attention of the housekeeping manager when we were there in May 09, but nothing was done. Why not hire an upholstrey cleaning services to clean the chairs and freshen the carpet. However, in spite of the poor housekeeping, we make the best of our stay and we do have a good time. Unfortunately, since we have been members, the quality of room housekeeping is getting worse. All other areas of the resort seem to be clean. However, in terms of location, the beautiful beach, and amazing ocean view from our room and the convenient location of restaurants, grocery store and shoppiing, you can't beat ESJ. The resort is self contained with its own grocery store, laudromat and underground parking garage. We love it there, it;s like a home away from home, I just wish they would start doing a better job cleaning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortabe with a great view”
Reviews.Author: lizzie1
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare exchange beginning of Feb. After reading all the negative reviews,we brought our own cleaning supplies. The studio unit had been remodeled and was spacious. Did some cleaning to meet our standards.Then we could relax. The view was wonderful. Can`t say enough about the wonderful staff.They did everything to make our vacation. Planning on two weeks next year. We did not rent a car,as we used the bus to go to Old San Juan .Did a tour of the rain forest.and Liquillo Beach with a pickup at the hotel. Enjoyed our time at ESJ

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking worked out great!”
Reviews.Author: Jilip08
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were supposed to go to Mexico, but swine flu broke out. We scrambled to make last minute plans, and found ESJ towers. We had arrived a bit early to our reservation, and the staff wasn't very helpful when we first checked in. Our room was clean, it had a kitchenette with dishes, silverware, coffee pot, stove, microwave, full fridge. Internet access in the room and cable tv. We were on the 12th floor and had a amazing view of the ocean and sunsets. The beach closes at sunset, which is a bit inconvenient, but the entire beaches can be accessed by a street a couple blocks away. There is a very large supermarket only 2 blocks away, continue straight out of ESJ towers entrance...VERY CONVENIENT. There was a bus stop less than a block away, which made it easy to get around. The pool area was clean, staff was friendly, and we had a blast playing BINGO! It's nothing super fancy, we didn't spend a lot of time there, but the time we did we were fine with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASED with this property”
Reviews.Author: Fourlaffs
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nite only but what a nite! Check in was fast, friendly and service was great. Cases delivered to our room promptly. Clean room with balcony, private beach nice view and many restaurants/shopping choices. Casino next door - LOVED the live music the place was hopping. Would stay @ this location again.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice get-away! centrally located with long beaches.....”
Reviews.Author: pyramoon
Reviews.Content: As i read through reviews of the ESJ Towers, I was a bit concerned over the amount of negative comment reviewers had left, then I reminded myself that most negative reviews i have read are created by super picky, crabapples, that like to tear everything apart and over analyze everything (some have legitmate complaints, i have experienced that others tend to be just too picky)......i wonder how their own homes would fair in a review if one was to stay with them!!! That being said, let me continue......We exchanged our timeshare, through interval, for a week's stay at the ESJ towers. It is minutes from the airport, costs about 10 bucks for a cab ride. The hotel/condominium (some people live there full time, this seems to be common) is located in Isla Verde, right on the beach. Yes, the lobby is a bit dark, so are the hallways, but not in a scary way.......there seems to have been a lot of fresh painting going on, as well as an overhaul of new carpet, decor, etc.. There is NO SMOKING inside the hotel and you are encouraged to smoke on your balcony, thankfully!!! Our room was on the 9th floor, overlooked some homes and the beach, this is a very populated area so wide open spaces are NOT to be found, other than the beaches. Our room had 2 double beds, they seemed a bit smaller than a traditional double, flat screen tv, kitchenette, with microwave, small stove, refrigerator with ice maker, sink, etc.. The room is decorated in that typical carrib/floridian motiff of pastels, flowers and wicker. Bathroom was a decent size, a little dated, but clean and large enough. There is a pool, which we never used, they claim it's olympic sized, but I don't think so. It is very basic with a lot of loungers lined up in rows with a little bar for snacks and cocktails......not my scene (there seems to be a large senior population that stays here), plus, i want to swim in the ocean! To access the beach, you must go down to B1 floor, walk a few feet throught the parking garage, where the fitness center is (it has showers, sauna, lockers, adjoins a long workout room). There you can pick up towels for the beach, if you need them and rent a lounge chair, if you want to, for 2.00 (they're 4.00 if you rent on the beach) which we didn't......i like laying on the sand! Go through security and you're on the beach. The beaches are all public, ESJ ensures that nobody wonders onto their property, who isn't a guest, by posting a guard at the front drive, front doors and beach side. It's NOT in an unsafe area, it's just to assure that the grounds are used by the guests only. Here's the deal about the beach......there are 2 bays......the one in front of the ESJ is long with a wide. white sanded beach, it's where most of the hotels are located. There is this seaweed "thing" that occurs a couple times per month where the ocean purges itself of seaweed and washes it up on the beach and is in the water......there are machines that they used to clean it up, but it's a lot......it runs in cycles down the beach, no big deal. We, however walked about a block over to go to the bay on the other side, where the surfers go, fo us to swim and sunbathe. it's about a 5 minute walk, down 2 streets to the the beach and a walk down the beach until we reached a spot we liked, usually between the ritz and the marriot. no seaweed on this side, it's a bit quieter and more sun. NOT to say that the beach in front of ESJ is bad, we used both beaches, we preferred the one on the "right" side..... The hotel is really right in the middle of everything; great restaurants, bus routes, grocery store around the corner, casinos, etc. The hotel also offers a concierge service which helped us pick out 2 excursions, a tour of old san juan, the fort and Bacardi rum, the other was to the El Yunque rainforest where we swam in a waterfall. Some key points: Try DONJOSE'S restaurant, just around the corner for AN EXCELLENT AUTHENTIC homestyle Puerto RIcan dinner, nothing fancy, but great food!!! The bus rides to old san juan are only .75 and take about 45 minutes and are an easy way to travel, but be aware that everybody in san juan drive like maniacs!! they make manhattan drivers look like they're standing still!!! We had an awesome stay here at the ESJ towers, remember, your vacation is what YOU make of it.....if you're going to be picky, crabby etc. that's the time you'll experience, you are going on a vacation to enjoy yourself, a hotel is NOT your home, NOT everything would be done as you would at your own home. Have fun, just enjoy what it has to offer and relax!!! We would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find Yourself Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fonsecae31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chanas which was the best of choices she is great considering short notice second time I went ,all is walking distance. I lived in Puerto Rico and this is one of the best beaches .Casino next door music well just about all u need .Went back same year and am planning my next vacation .Only one thing I did not like much going through garage to access beach but once u do it plenty of security which is great Second time I traveled alone.!

Reviews.Title: “CONDO FROM HELL”
Reviews.Author: aida61boston
Reviews.Content: We rented condo #1654 from Jaro Management a private owner, (which is not part of the ESJ management). When we first arrived, the condo has a chemical odor (we later found, it was fumagated within minutes of our arrival). The balcony door had no lock which presented a safety hazard for our 7 year old (the owners never told us about the missing lock. When I called to notify them, they said "it was not feasible at this time to install a new lock". 3 days into the stay, we saw roaches in the kitchen. The toaster and coffee maker were very old and unusable. The stove was so old, you couldn't see the numbers on the dials. We didn't use the utensils which were also old. The owners kept $125 of our $200 deposit along with the $60 cleaning fee. They claimed one of the dishes was missing, the old coffee pot was broken and that we left hazardous material (diabetic syringes) behind (which we stored in a proper contained). The cleaning fee should've of covered the disposal of the container...We've never had any problems with other condo owners whom we've rented from. We were very disappointed with the condo and the owners, but the hotel staff and service were very professional and customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever I stayed at..........”
Reviews.Author: ShanaSn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing. The view was horrible. The room had a smell to it. Hard to sleep when you have a LOUD AC unit on your patio outside from your bed. Had to get your own towels and toliet paper when needed. NO maid service. Water pressure for the toliet and shower was horrible. You had to rent chairs for the beach. The hotel keys worked on and off. Only good thing was the outside staff employees were very very freindly and the rest of the staff was not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Towers - Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: M&CMother
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Puerto Rico - we stayed at the Marriott in Condado for 3 nights, followed by 2 nights in Vieques and came back for a night, where we stayed at the ESJ Towers because of its convenience to the airport and the beach access. After a great stay at the Marriott, I was a bit worried that ESJ would not measure up but the unit was great - full kitchen, large bathroom and the room was much larger that the Marriott room. We had a great view of the pool and beach. We took advantage of the pool, beach (nicer than the Marriott beach area), gym (small but adequate) and free breakfast (very large - eggs, waffles, etc.). We ate dinner at the nearby Intercontinental, where there is an informal bar/restaurant right on the beach. ESJ staff was friendly. Downsides were the $20 cab rides to Old San Juan (I think the rate is supposed to be $19, but I was charged anywhere from $19-22/one way, which adds up) and the lobby is a bit dark. But all in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome studio rental”
Reviews.Author: SeeYaOnTheBeach
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in one of Chana's studio apartments on the 15th floor in May 2009. The view was awesome, something I could never get tired of even if I saw it everyday. The studio was perfect for us. King bed, couch, cold fridge, kitchen area, dining table, wine bottle opener, A/C. You can open both doors up all the way that lead to the balcony which really makes it feel like outside is coming in. I would totally stay here again if I had the constant funds to support my Caribbean craving. This place is probably geared more towards families, but if you travel there in May or other off season months it's probably pretty low key (as was our stay). There's only two things that kind of suck about ESJ. One is that if you want to get food or drinks by the pool they charge it to your room tab, you can't just pay separately with a card. Two is that if you rent a car, there's a chance that someone's guest could be parked in your spot. We got a rental, went to our assigned parking spot and had to wait 45 minutes for the owner to come move it. All of the staff at ESJ were very helpful and kind. Not one complaint about the service, if anything I compliment them. They always greeted us when we were coming in or heading out, always hailed down a taxi like it was an emergency, helped with questions about whatever we asked. It was nice not to have to deal with them directly for our billing though, that's one reason why you should definitely rent from Chana. It's ESJ for less! Not to mention El San Juan Hotel and Casino is literally next door. Thanks Chana you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Edgardo_Guiseppe
Reviews.Content: We rent from Mrs. Chana Cohen one of her apartment in the 4th floor. We only have good things to say about it. The apartment was extremely clean very comfortable with a great ocean view from our balcony and bedrooms we was able to hear the ocean waves 24 hours, very relaxing. The ESJ Tower staff is very friendly and always willing to help and assist you. The security in the building is great we feel safe at all times during our stay. The building is very well maintains and the location is great walking distance to restaurants, hotels, casinos, beach, etc. Definitely I recommend this place without any doubt especially if you can rent from Chana she is a great lady easy to deal with very pleasant and always willing to help you and make your stay the best one.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!”
Reviews.Author: conchiNewYrok
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Chana Cohen's condo #1769. This very spacious and more than comfortable condo has a breadth taking view of the ocean. It was so relaxing to fall asleep listening to the waves and our morning walks along the beach made it just perfect!! While sitting on the balcony during the day hours, we enjoyed the music from the San Juan Resort which fit in perfectly with the ocean view. It was definitely an experience to see, feel, run, read, sip, savor to remember and repeat....

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: p415b
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to go to Puerto Rico and not stay in your room alot, than you really can't beat the ESJ Towers. It is located next to the vintage yet fabulous El San Juan Hotel & Casino. At ESJ, you get what you paid for. It is certainly not a 5 star hotel, maybe not even a 4 star hotel. But you do get a roof over your head and safe place to rest at. The staff is more than friendly and I'd advise if you do decide to to a tour (snorkeling, El Yunque, Bio Bay) than get it through the staff in the lobby. It is well worth it. Don't forget to go to San Juan Water & beach Club Hotel which is about 3 blocks away to the west (pass the Intercontinental Hotel - on the beach). There roof top bar is cool and night and the ambience is great. NO COVER charge. All in all, the ESJ Towers is what it is....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MarisolNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the beach and right next to one of the nicest hotels and casinos in Puerto Rico. And the price is very reasonable. During the day you get to enjoy Isla Verde Beach and in the evening you are a short walk away from the casinos and nightculbs down the street in other hotels. All the rooms have a kitchen so you don't have to eat all your meals out. It is walking distance to a supermarket. It is also near a bus stop where you can get a bus going to Old San Juan and to Condado. You can even take the same bus to/from the airport. Great if you don't want to rent a car. And if you do, car rentals are also down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town! Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: otissito
Reviews.Content: Hook up with one of the owners who rent out their apartments from ESJ Tower. The location is 10 minutes from Munoz Marin International Hotel. The cost is- CHEAP! With free parking on site, depending on the owner. The pool, gym, beach, Bar, food store are both convenient and pleasant. I really, really, like this place. Right next door to the famous San Juan Casino and Hotel. BTW, it may say Carolina, but it is really Isla Verde and the beach is beautiful, safe and right behind the ESJ complex. There are many places to eat around the area, my favorite is a small Criolla restaurant off the main street, across from the ESJ. The best bet is to walk out of the complex toward the main street, and bear right until you seek the strip mall across the street, Walk across and keep to your left hand side, you will see a small restuarant crowded with people , that's it! Great Deats!!!!!!!!!!!! I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Right on the beach, kitchenette in each room”
Reviews.Author: PaulHMA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a babymoon trip. We stayed for a week and loved it. The location was great, the hotel was up-to-date and the staff were fantastic. We chose this hotel because, and especially liked that each room has a kitchen (full size fridge, oven, stove, microwave and fully stocked with plates/pots/utensils). If we go back to PR, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my trip. The hotel was tolerable...”
Reviews.Author: pluckyshea
Reviews.Content: My trip overall was great. The hotel was nothing to write home about. It needs to be remodeled, desperately. It was clean. The hotel employees were all very friendly and helpful. We had to change rooms in the middle of the trip, but the staff made the transition seamlessly. In fact, the second room had a better view than the first one!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: quepasa48
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say this Hotel was Amazing. We stayed for 10 days, and had a wonderful time. We rented weekly with Chana. She is just great. At the end of our stay, my nephew left his game console behind- rushing to catch our 6:00am flight, he forgot it. Anyway, we realized on the flight when he wanted to play with it, that he forgot it. A day later we contacted Chana and told her abt. it . She checked the room for us and found the console and mailed it back to us. We were so appreciated!!! We can't Thank her enough. Can't wait to visit again. ESJ AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: sailorche
Reviews.Content: We rented with Chana Cohen. Two words: Hassle Free. We rented a 2 BR oceanfront. I cannot begin to explain how wonderful our experience was. Isla Verde is a gorgeous beach. We were so close to the ocean ,we could hear the waves rolling in all through the night. The building is a condo/hotel with all the amenities a tourist could want but with the advantages of having a full kitchen. I recommend this place for larger groups or families with children. If you are looking for trendy , go elsewhere. The San Juan hotel is practically connected to the ESJ. We took full advantage of this and went over there for our daily starbucks fix, not to mention the live music they have in the lobby. Our apartment was fully equipped with everything you could need! ESJ is close to everything!!!! LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all that you read. We enjoyed ESJ Towers!”
Reviews.Author: theetoysurgeon
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Juan PR by way of a timeshare trade through II. I had read most of the reviews before we left and was a little apprehensive. We are beach people and Isle Verde has a nice beach, some trash, but no sewage nor broken glass. We were not hassled by vendors, locals sell beer($3), water and drinks($1) on the beach. The beach bars are more expensive. After 6pm the noseeums bugs come out and attack with all teeth. Don't rent an umbrella($10/day) when there is plenty of shade under the palms. The hotel was nice, we were on the east side, 3rd floor, full shade by noon with a nice ocean breeze. Room was an efficiency with 2 double beds, kitchen with full fridge and a full bathrrom. It was enough for my wife, daughter(19) and me. Corners of the floor and the bedspreads could have been a bit cleaner but the towels, sheets, carpet, dishes, fridge were all clean. ESJ overdoes security with the pool and beach access closing at 7pm. Requires ESJ bracelets are bit much for using the pool and beach. Access to the fitness room ( beach gear, towels and replacement room linens) was easy to find and no hassle. As for eating, we ate at Metropol, (to the left of the security gate 2 blocks for PR cusine and was nice. We ate mostly ate at Lupi's sports bar right by the main road entrance, which as great ! I highly suggest the grouper fingers! Old SanJuan is accesible by taxi for $21 each way. The best thing we did was the Catamaran tour and for $80 per person its the best money you ever spent. If I knew it was that cool we would have done it several times. All the staff and locals were always friendly. The Pueblo grocery is 2 blocks walking straight out of the ESJ entrance and a Walgreens was 2 blocks to the left of the entrance. The worst thing we encountered was the damn Card keys to access your room, pool and beach. they hardly worked! We would stay there again for sure. Write me at thetoysurgeon@charter.net for more reviews and pics.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it- rent from Maria O'Neill”
Reviews.Author: virtue37_4
Reviews.Content: I visited San Juan with a group of 6- 4 women in their 20's and two in their 50's. We rented from Maria O'Neill, who advertised on vrbo.com. If you would like her contact information, please send me a message and I will forward it to you. She sent us pictures of her place, and it was exactly as we would have imagined. 10 minutes from the airport, 14th floor condo with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. This was perfect for us, since there were two mother/daughter pairs, and then two others. The mothers and daughters had 1 queen room, 1 king master room, and the other two friends each had their own twin bed in another bedroom. Plenty of closet and drawer space. Each room had a window that looked out to the ocean. And the view from the balcony!! :) It was the first thing we saw when walking into the condo! Absolutely breathtaking. As we were a group of women, we felt very secure since there were 3 doors (with locks) to enter the condo. The hotel is a little old and dated, but I don't care about that as long as the room is great. I think the issue of your room depends upon the owner of the condo itself. Our owner had great taste in decorating and made sure our condo was very clean, so we had no issues. Plenty of towels were provided. There was a wall-mounted TV in each bedroom. Cute bathroom soaps and shampoo were supplied. The beds were incredibly comfortable. Kitchen had a large fridge, microwave, toaster oven, and washer and dryer in the far corner. Plenty of storage space for your food and drinks. The staff was great; extremely helpful whenever we needed it. Everyone was friendly and offered great advice. The one negative I have is that I would not recommend the breakfast buffet- at $13 pp, it was not worth it at all. It just didn't look appetizing, and it was not that much of a buffet- not that many choices available. And you couldn't pay cash, you had to charge it to the room. Why charge it when I have the cash right here? There were two rooms that had 3 computers available in each for free. It was nice to check email and print out our boarding passes at no charge. I only had to wait for a computer once, and then only for about 5 mins. The beach in front of this property is great. It was not that big a deal going to the ground floor and walking through the parking lot for 10 seconds to get to the beach. Towels could be picked up on the way to the beach, supplied in a room in the garage. Chairs were available for rental at $4 each, umbrellas at $10. Right next to the El San Juan hotel, so we went to their pool bar for drinks, and there was a cart on the beach that sold chicken and beef skewers, hot dogs, water, etc. The water was perfect- nice and warm enough so that there was no shock upon entering, but cool enough for a break from the sun and heat. The waves were gentle, but high enough to have fun jumping in them. The sand was soft too. We could see the airplanes taking off from SJU from the beach, but the noise was minimal. We could barely hear them. There was a dispatcher at the entrance of the hotel, so if you needed a cab, you waited for less than 5 mins for one. We usually got one right away. The A5 bus also stopped right out front of the El San Juan hotel. We never rode it, preferring to take a taxi. Within walking distance is a Walgreens, Denny's (for breakfast), Outback steakhouse, Ponderosa, etc. We ate mostly in OSJ. I would recommend you look up La Bombonera, Barrachina (dinner and a flamenco dancing show), and El Asador (open air dining and bar). We used Castillo Tours for a sailing and snorkeling trip. Nice since one of their offices was in the hotel lobby, and we received transportation right from the hotel that day. Well worth the $80 pp for the whole day's transportation, sailing, drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic), lunch, and snorkeling. Overall, I would stay at this place again with a group. If you're looking for a place for couples, I wouldn't recommend it. But it's absolutely perfect for groups of friends, or for families who need the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Thnaks, Chana!!”
Reviews.Author: Naptown
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Isla Verde, Puerto Rico, where we rented from Chana Cohen,[--] and she was great !.Our room at ESJ was right on the ocean like she had said & ready for us. Parking is free & so is Internet service. No pressure from Chana.Walking distance to everything,bus stop to San Juan a few steps from the hotel. Everyone was so helpful. We even left our camera in a taxi in Vieques ,was found & the taxi cab driver will be mailing it back to us!! People in Puerto Rico rock!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value/ Trustworthy - Chana Cohen at ESJ”
Reviews.Author: Back2PuertoRico
Reviews.Content: If you want a great value for a low, fair price, then consider renting from Chana at ESJ Towers in Isla Verde. This was our 2nd visit to ESJ. This time we booked with Chana and she was so helpful. The credit card transaction was accurate and secure. Chana even gave us our choice of room. The location was ideal for us. It's a beachfront hotel that is just a short ride into Old San Juan. Also, the El San Juan casino is next door, if you like the slot machines (I do). There's plenty of dining choices within easy walking distance. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The AC works well. Has a full-kitchen. There's so much more at ESJ than you get in standard hotels. Our room had a washer / dryer.- perfect so you don't have to pack dirty clothes at the end of your stay. The pool is clean, large and not over-crowded. Same goes for the beach The grounds are well-maintained and secure. The parking garage underneath the towers is a convenience you don't find in most of the other hotels. And parking comes at a premium in all parts of San Juan. There's a sundry shop that keeps decent hours. Be sure to book with Chana. http://www.esjtowers4less.com From what I saw, her rooms are nicer. Basically, everything you need is at ESJ. And it's a great launching pad for visiting the sites around the island. I spent 6 months in Puerto Rico 2008. This is the best deal you're going to get in San Juan. Email if you have any questions. John Eubank [--]

Reviews.Title: “Good location and kitchen”
Reviews.Author: PT77
Reviews.Content: We rented a one bedroom for a week at the ESJ. We rented directly from the owner. The tower has its own access gate to the beach and a good pool. The breakfast was good. Friendly staff. We rented beach chairs at the fitness center $2. Umlimited towels were also available. The beach umbrellas can also be rented on the beach for $10 for the whole day. Free car parking. The restaurent on site closes at 2.30 PM. Mini market on site was very convinient. This is not an ideal " resort" vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: momo4444
Reviews.Content: I thought ESJ Towers was a very satisfactory place to stay. We got a room there for a week through a timeshare company, not sure which one. I was a bit worried at check-in because the common areas downstairs didn't seem like much and were kind of dark and dreary. But our room was so bright and spacious, and we had a view of the ocean toward Pinones as well as over part of Carolina. It was terrific to have a full kitchen, and the grocery store was a 10minute walk away. My only complaint is about cleanliness - the maid wasn't thorough; we found several sunflower seed hulls on the floor by the patio door which was gross cuz obviously the last slobby guest had spit them out of his/her mouth. And there were some dirt marks on the floors in the bathroom, like the maid had cleaned with a dirty mop or just smeared some of the dirt instead of wiping it all up. The shower didn't drain that great, either. But I thought the location was terrific - right on the beach, a really nice long public beach. It was wonderful to wake up, walk through the building, and be on the sand immediately. And it is next door to San Juan Resort and Casino, which is *much* nicer and you can walk over there if you want to have an upscale meal or a drink at a really good-looking bar or do a bit of gambling. The concierges were pretty helpful in giving information about all the sightseeing we wanted to do, though there was one young woman who wasn't so good - didn't know where to tell us to rent a catamaran. We didn't interact with staff that much otherwise. I'd stay here again - it's more than fine for people who plan to spend most of their day on the beach or sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Go with Chana Cohen”
Reviews.Author: eddie3500
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ESJ From 5/30 too June 6 2009 rented thru Chana Cohen Had 1 Bedroom fully furnished and Full Kitchen, Ocean and Pool View she Has up too 3 bedrooms Condo and reasonable Price Next too restaurants and Casinos

Reviews.Title: “Private Rental”
Reviews.Author: sc2dogs
Reviews.Content: Rented a unit from Chana Cohen. Very easy to deal with, very fair value for lovely unit. Unit could use some minor repairs, but was clean, quiet well located with great access to everything. Great stay in a great place. Paul & Delores Johnson

Reviews.Title: “Chana Cohen!!! ESJ Tower”
Reviews.Author: Sulu1219
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience! My fiancee and I were planning our destination wedding and decided to do it somewhere around Isla Verde. We started looking for places to say and finally decided to book a room with Ms. Chana Cohen. Although some of the things we heard about the ESJ Towers was not 100% positive, I can honestly tell you what we heard was absolutely wrong! This place is amazing, the people are excellent, the value is unbeatable, and the location... WOW, (walk down stairs and you're at the beach) This place within walking distance to everything and and they even have a cab station right at the gate. Lets just put it this way, I will never stay anywhere else in Puerto Rico. Do yourself a favor, call Ms. Chana Cohen and book your stay with her. Believe me, you will thank me later!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sschwed
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews on this site. I actually got nervous about the hotel. If you want a $400 dollar a night room don't pay $195 and expect to get one. I enjoyed my stay at ESJ. The pool was large and beautifiul. The entire staff was gracious and helpful. The rooms were large and exactly like they were on their webstie. Acess to the beach was no problem like one review stated. Down one floor out the elevator and across the one driveway to a beautiful clean beach. The Mamno bar was very nice, they had pool tables, large spacious lobby, nice mini market. The location couldn't be better, grocery store around the corner, casino"s next door, cab always waiting outside the door, near the bus stop and popular restruants. I didn't want to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - Rented through Regal Caribbean Properties”
Reviews.Author: PR_Lovers
Reviews.Content: We love Puerto Rico and we had a great time at ESJ Towers! The people there could not have been nicer--they went out of their way to make sure our stay was the best. And, we got to play ping-pong and billards, swim in the pool and enjoyed that View ( ! ! ! ) from the balcony in our unit, breath-taking to say the least. Everything was exactly, as stated in their website. (http://www.vacationrentals-pr.com) Our our return flight( on American Airlines ) back to Miami, the recording star, Chayenne, and his wife and two children, sat across the aisle from us (we got his autograph) and he wished us a nice trip and safe journey. He was so nice ! It was a real thrill to see him in person. When we return to San Juan, we will rent from Regal Caribbean again.

Reviews.Title: “Late Night Music Next Door is Out of Control!”
Reviews.Author: MBroyhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ESJ for a few nights in Jan/Feb. We stayed there because it was arranged for us, not because we chose the hotel. The staff was very very accommodating and the food at the restaurant was good. Location on the beach was excellent, even though you had to get a cab to go into Old San Juan. The decor could use some serious updating from the 70s we encountered. Although it seemed like most of those staying there probably bought their time shares during that decade and nothing had changed since. Honestly other than the decor, the biggest issue was the loud music from the club next door on Saturday night. We had to get up very early on Sunday for an excursion and the music went until 1 am. I had earplugs and a pillow over my head and it still didn't drown out the neighborhood club. I think it's some kind of Cuban social club. I called the front desk at about 10 pm to see what the noise was, and they said there was nothing they could do and that they could play their music until 1 am. I realize that staying in on a Saturday night in San Juan was not exactly normal, but we had to be up by 5 am. In any case, the volume of the music honeslty can't be overstated and for that reason alone I would not stay there again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Renting from Chana Cohen”
Reviews.Author: IslaVerdefan
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth year for my wife and I to rent a fully furnished apartment from Ms. Chana Cohen in in the esj towers in Carolina, Puerto Rico. Each winter we have rented the apartment for six weeks to three months and it has been both smooth and enjoyable. In addtition to our regular rental of a large apartment from her we have at times rented three other smaller apartments for our adult children when they came to Puerto Rico to participate in a family event. All have had a similar positive and enjoyable experience. When we arrive for our vacation, checking in is smooth and we find that every area of the apartment has been thoroughly cleaned and the apartment is fully equipped for a family's daily needs (fully equipped kitchen, sheets, towels, etc.). On the few occasions when we had to request a minor repair or extra glasses, Mrs. Cohen took care of our needs promptly, efficiently, and competently. Mrs. Cohen's rental apartments are comfortable, clean, well maintained, reasonably priced, on the beach and in a safe building. My wife and I recommend her strongly.

Reviews.Title: “esj --chana cohen”
Reviews.Author: snowhater_9
Reviews.Content: we as a family with four kids and only limited funds for vacation stumbled on the internet and found ESJ and Chana Cohen.We have rented with Chana ,and this will be our 5th year in 2009 and we are stayin for almost the whole month of March.We love it here and that is why we keep coming back.We always stay in a 2 bedroom condo that has everything you need including a washer and dryer.The location is great.Try to stay anywhere else on this beach and you will be paying 3 times the amount.We do not shop in the hotel store because it has limited choices and is a bit expensive,but great for emergencys.There is a 24hour supermarket a block and half away and I mean a super one.It has everything and also cooked food and all alcohols and wine and beer.Great pool,beach is on the property,no walking on the streets to get to beach.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth time a ESJ Through "Chana"”
Reviews.Author: retlawbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: ESJ January 2009 , We just returned from a week stay in a studio at ESJ. We had a marvelous time. Room was clean and comfortable. ESJ is in a great location (Las Vegas Of Isla Verde) Couldn't be better situated in a central location for a reasonable price. Garage has free parking if you rent a car. This is the fourth time that we have rented through Chana. Each time we have been given great rooms and friendly service. What a great get-away for a winter weary Brooklynite. Three cheers for Chana,, Walter and Marilyn Cuff

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico, Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bits77
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at ESJ Towers through a timeshare service. The timeshare is owned by my mother in law and she was able to transfer her week to us. This was our first trip to PR. I had read reviews of ESJ before going and was so scared at what I would find. But the cost for us was so cheap (about $175 for the whole week) I couldnt pass it up. Let me outline the good things about staying here first. The hotel is a short ride from the Airport. There are several resturaunts within walking distance. There are many "American" amenities nearby such as a walgreens and fast food resturaunts. The bus stop is close. The beach was decent and the pool was nice. They have a play area for kids. The staff was nice. We had a pretty good view on a nice little terrace. They have high speed internet acess. Now the bad news. The entrance to the hotel is located in a weird spot. I think some people live here full time so there is a security gate at the front. then down a long road, on the side of the building is the main entrance. Not too big of a deal but kind of a long walk if you are on foot. The lobby was very outdated- fantasy island style. They have an arcade also outdated. And a small grovery store insanely over priced. I had read other reviews about how gross the rooms were. They were not exaggerating! The room smelled horrible! We finally got to the source of it- it was comming from the sink in the mini kitchen. It smelled like rotten food. I didnt ask to change rooms becuase I had read that they wont accomodate. Also there is not maid service for the timeshare rooms. So you have to go to the garage and change out towels. We sprayed air freshner the whole time we were there. We didnt use the kitchen at all so it was pointless. The beds were hard as rocks. The floors looked like they hadnt been swept or mopped in ages. The whole room was outdated. The shower was old, and the faucet kinda rusty but tolerable. Getting to the pool and beach sucked. You had to go downstairs through the parking garage. Kind of a schlep. You have to rent beach chairs. We rented a car the last three days there and the parking garage sucks! I would avoid staying here ever again unless I stayed for cheap and before I booked I would let them know about my previous experience and hope they would put me somewhere better. The only upside was that Puerto Rico was amazing. It was the best vacation I have had to date. We did so much we were only in the room at night so we dealt with it. Definately go to Puerto Rico. If you are staying around San Jaun, avoid this place. You have to go to the bioluminescent (sp) bay in Fajardo. Have Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at ESJ”
Reviews.Author: aggupta
Reviews.Content: My family booked 8 condos at the ESJ towers for my wedding. The ESJ is clean, comfortable, and most importantly, the beach is easily accessible. I would highly recommend staying there if you are on a budget or you have a large group traveling together. You are close to all of the amenities of the El San Juan Hotel and an easy cab ride from Old San Juan and the airport. Another perk is that most of the private apartments come with 1 parking spot which is very convenient if you plan to rent a car. I was in a 2 BR with 1 and a half bath (apt 475). The view was amazing and the apartment can hold up to 6 people. We rented through Chana Cohen who was both friendly and highly responsive to all of our needs. You can contact her through her website: http://www.esjtowers4less.com/ Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love Puerto Rico, ESJ a good enough choice”
Reviews.Author: lscott
Reviews.Content: Traded our Florida timeshare for the 2nd time in about 5 years to ESJ, our 3rd trip to PR. We like PR because it is a Real Place, with history,variety of landscapes and friendly proud people, not just built for tourists. Everywhere we went, including villages, looked fairly well maintained and prosperous. This time our unit #553 was like a hotel room with a small kitchen (apt. range, sink, full refrig, microwave, dishes for 4) Last time we had more space but in sight and sound of nearby airport. This time balcony overlooked ocean; well, actually rooftops and very noisy service area, but wide ocean view beyond. Double beds, lots of bamboo furniture with many drawers. Room had new looking blue/green pattern carpeting, peach colored walls, tropic colored bedspreads and drapes. Table and chairs for 4. As exchangers we had no maid service which suited us fine. Bathroom had separate bath and toilet space, large sink and vanity space with closet and adequate hangers. Small soaps, extra tissue. Paper towels and dish cloth thingy in kitchen but no detergent. Not much contact with personnel but what we had was efficient and pleasant. Key cards did not always work for access doors to beach and pool. Watch that tricky gate to beach. Have to set it just right, punch in numbers and move quickly. I and many others got caught in between like a monkey in a cage and had to wait for assistance, but got used to it. Beach beautiful and long around the coast, great for walking and sunning but not many people using it for swimming, except on a holiday while we were there, lots of local families..Before, we went to Luquillo Beach along the coast to the east, famous and beautiful but we did not get there this time We (senior citizens) enjoyed just sitting on beach, reading (chairs $2.14 daily, towels free) and sitting around the pool. Rented Corolla from Hertz,, found out at last minute that our home insurance did not cover PR so had to buy expensive insurance; therefore we felt obligated to make good use of the car. Went to El Yunque rain forest one day, our 3rd time, but they have built a really nice visitor's center since last time with exhibits and facilities. We drove only as far as the tower and climbed up for the view, did not penetrate any farther. Lovely weather all the time we were there this week, 84 degrees and very little rain. Drove into Old San Juan, finally found parking garage. OUr car was equipped with GPS and we really used it but not always understandable in city and mountain villages with one way streets and detours. Traffic seems much much heavier than our last trip. Roads are good and well marked but lots of traffic and delays, even on the four lanes. We walked the usual tourist route, El Morro etc, in Old San Juan, had lunch near the cathedral. Husb wanted to drive into the mountainous interior. From an article in Que Pasa maga zine we chose Barranquitas with lunch stop in Aibonito and programmed car to take us by scenic mountain routes. It was that all right, round and round and up and down, good well marked roads but narrow and curving. Beautiful scenery of mountains. Had lunch at Aibonito and returned, did not make it to Barq. As previous reviews, we returned nearly every night to our fav restaurant, Mi Casita, also ate at Chili's across street from ESJ entrance gate. Minimarket in ESJ is well supplied but expensive. We bought breakfast supplies. There is a grocery store next door to Mi Casita. El San Juan resort and casino next door was a Wyndam property last trip. Expensive restaurants which we did not use this time. Casino took our money and did not pay off as well as last time so did not spend as much time there. Seems to have been "ritzier" and dressier when it was a Wyndam.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: Matt44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a penthouse unit at the ESJ for four nights. Reviews of this property are accurate. The facilities are reasonable with some inconveniences. Our studio was clean and well equiped. The elevator to the 16th floor was quick. The elvevator was necessary often as the beach, lobby and pool are on seperate floors. It is nesessary to use a coded keycard to a access the pool area. Pool is OK. You get a towel with no hassle. No access to the beach and beers are $4.50 You must buy them from ESJ. The pool has no slide, floatation devices, umbrellas or filter. An out of water filter is mobile and used to clean the water. To get to the beach, back on the elevator and down to the garage. Pick up complementary chairs and towels. Lug them through the garage to a revolving privacy gate and enter the code. You must stick the chairs through the opening of the fence and gather them on the other side. Very old chairs but they work. No bathrooms or concessions available. The local area has some good restaurants . Mi Casini is a block West in a shopping center. It is excellent. To the East is Interpol. Also very good but no breakfast. Rented a car as there is not much to do locally. Reasonable rates. Advised by ESJ to look for our P-spot as they are not in order for security reasons. Four floors of searching random numbers. We never found it in two days. Ran the risk of using guest parking and won. We still can't make sense of this. Also, the conciere was helpful in calling the rental company but not much help in pointing out that they were looking for us outside while I roamed the lobby for 20 minutes.
