Internet access is their strong point. Available all day with no wait, We never venture to SJ before. Probably will avoid in the future. Expensive and inferior to remote islands in the Carribean.

Reviews.Title: “Rent a Condo at ESJ Towers”
Reviews.Author: katfazz
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo in the ESJ Towers directly from the owner. Cost effective and spacious unit. See the website esjtowers4less.com. For a family, this is the way to go and I will not rent regular hotel rooms in PR anymore. We had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, LR, DR, kitchen & balcony for a lower price than a standard hotel room. You arrange with owner, check in directly at hotel desk, and pay owner after seeing the condo. Beautiful pool, snack bar, cocktail lounge, mini-mart and right on the Isla Verde beach. Walking distance to many restaurants and other hotel properties. We will always rent from Chana on future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip”
Reviews.Author: neenz223
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ESJ on 8/11-8/16 and had a great time. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms at least need to be updated. Accomodations were clean and staff very helpful and friendly. Was leary of going because I went alone but I felt safe there and the beach was beautiful. Concierge offered tours, so I went on the El Yunque Rainforest tour and then the Barcardi Distillery and Old San Juan afternoon tour. Lots of things to do even though I went by myself. Happy Apple Restaurant was terrble-would not suggest anyone going there. Told me it was a "buffet" ($13 that was charged to my room) but the buffet was chicken vegetable lasagna with green beans and rolls ??? I wouldn't call that a buffet! Other con was the a/c unit was right outisde on the balcony and it was very noisy-no way to talk on a cell on the balcony while it was running and had a hard time sleeping because of it. Depsite that it was a great trip and ESJ wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Dated ESJ Towers”
Reviews.Author: mendiola1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ESJ TOWERS the beginning of July. Checking was quick and uneventful. We stayed on the 6TH floor which faced the east side and some partial views of the Atlantic. As far as Personnel, every one was very receptive to requests.You have to request towels for the beach, but the location is on the way to the beach, so it is not inconvenient. What is inconvenient is when you have to walk all the way to such location for your room towels or toilet paper. The access to the beach as right behind the hotel, but we were perplexed by the fact that it does close at 7:00pm, yet you can walk a few blocks and have access to it. Perhaps this is to reduce liability for the Hotel, however, when the pool closes also at 7:00 pm , it really puts a hamper on trying to relax and enjoy the premises after dinner. The beach was extremely busy, but it could have been due to the date, we were there for the 4th of July. As far as the pool, was clean and a decent size. The lounge chairs were in great condition and there was some cabanas with tables provided, and the towels for the pool were actually provided right there also. You do need to provide for the room key so they will attach a band in order for one to have access to the pool. The room was a different story, although the beds and sheets were very clean, the carpet and the bedspreads/window treatments contrasted. Not that we expect everything to match, but there are somethings that could be done to create a more inviting room.The kitchen was mainly a galley kitchen, but it did have all the necessities needed for cooking, except for a blender. That was one necessity that should be incorporated, perhaps they could save the money they are spending on the hand bands at the pool and purchase the blenders. Although, our room faced a residential area, it still had some partial views of the Atlantic. The balcony was big enough to add a couple of chairs and small table, but at least if offered such an amenity, although, the A/C unit could be quite noisy.We did have breakfast one day at their restaurant, once again the decor was drab looking and the lighting was too dull. We had breakfast for 2, it was about $24 for a hot breakfast, nothing out of the ordinary, except for a gregarious middle age woman who sang to us and everyone else there while serving coffee. She was the only Sunshine in that location.There is a small store on the premises, and it carries the necessities.The hotel is very centrally located so you can walk to restaurants, and other hotels. It does sit behind the El San Juan, which like many big name hotels, has a Casino. Also, straight out of the hotel, you can find a supermarket, you could walk, but it might be about 8 or so blocks. If you have a rental, you will need to fight for the "guest" spot in the underground garage.If you are not satisfied with the beach in front of the hotel, do walk a few blocks to the east, it is situated between the Ritz and the Marriott, it is less busy and quite smooth.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place...”
Reviews.Author: hmulloa
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a six day stay in a studio with my husband, sister, 4 yr old daughter and 20 month old son. Yes, a lot of people but it worked fine. After reading a lot of these reviews I felt I knew what to expect and that's what it was. The decor is from the 70/80s but regardless the room and hotel were clean. The sheets had an emblem of the hotel with the year 1975â€¦ think that was the last time they ever made any changes. The point of this trip was simply to visit Puerto Rico for leisure and tourist attractions. That's what this hotel was perfect for. We woke up every day, got ready and went out. This hotel met that need. There were the occasional rain showers that forced us to stay a couple of hours and it was okay. We rented a car and that's something I would recommend. We never ate at the hotel restaurant based on the recommendations on this website. We did buy groceries on our first day and had breakfast in the room every day. I even cooked dinner two days and had everything I needed there in the small kitchen. If you are planning on using a computer while there, I would recommend you take your own if possible. Every time I went to the â€œbusiness centerâ€�, there were teenagers on all six computers using MySpace. They aren't supposed to be on there (a sign reads â€œno minors!â€�) but you can't get them off. While I was there a lady asked a 10-12 year old boy if she could use the computer. The boy left and returned with his mother who almost got into a catfight with the lady over this. Management came and took care of it. Regardless, the wait and the fact that no one monitored this (until after the scandal) was ridiculous. Finally, the only thing that was odd to us was that ever time you needed anything (towels, clean sheets, toilet paper, etc.) you had to go to the basement to get these items. They didn't bring anything to you. Did I mention that you are charged $5 a day for these items? That is what I did mind, but simply thought "oh well". Other people on this website seem to have minded the fact that they needed a code to get to the beach but I felt secure because of that. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Isla Verde (Port of Reeko)”
Reviews.Author: Melevated
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed in the ESJ Towers for 10 days. Upon our arrival, the door to our studio unit broke before we were unpacked and locked us out. The property owner came after waiting over an hour. We used the sliding patio door and left our personal belongings in our unlocked room for the first day of vacation until they repaired the locking mechanism. Our private porch consisted of hot, sticky, tacky green flooring with 5' concrete walls that hid our view from the pool, but allowed mop water from other balconies. And as for the door leading to the pool; it automatically locked after closing it and our owner provided no key, even after we demanded one. So we used a nearby concrete ledge to step up and over the wall to our room until security (I like to refer to him as the towel nazi) scolded us. So poolside was NOT poolside and even if it were easy to get to and from the pool from our "poolside" room, the pool only overlooked a portion of the beach, but was not accessible from the pool. We had to walk back indoors, take the elevator to the parking garage, walk 5 minutes through the garage to the towel rental room (which was often vacant), and then through a sequence of secured doors (swipe cards) and when we made it outside alas, we had to remember a 6-digit security number to get to and from the beach. A code that, although I kept forgetting (I'm sorry i WAS on vacation after all) other guests and locals alike recited whenever I chose to walk the beach, I mean between the hours of 9am-7pm of course. Once on the beach, we found the need for sandals, as glass and seaweed cluttered the shore. To the right, we noticed that raw sewage was being emptied directly onto the beach from a restaurant, so that area was out of the question. For the remainder of the vacation we swam in the pool, played poolside BINGO (which was the only quality entertainment, if that floats your boat) and walked along the shore, but we never felt a sense of security or safety, maybe a sign from all of the beautifully landscaped RAZOR WIRE that made me feel like I was in Alcatraz. We thought we would try the rest of the island, since we read about beautiful beaches in Puerto Rico. Another let down. Don't try to travel the island in a day, it takes forever considering there are only 3 places of interest along the way (tolls ranged from .50-$1.75). The town of Ponce, with it's cute marina appeal, isn't worth the drive with it's shallow coral beach, not to mention the public bathrooms that were splattered with human waste (a recurring theme in Puerto Rico). San Juan is what it is, a port town that attracts cruise ship tourists. I do, however, recommend the El Morro Castle tours in Old San Juan. Overall, ESJ Towers is not a beach destination. And since the building itself casts a shadow over it's own pool until almost noon everyday, and the stand up jacuzzi closes at 4pm, I can't say it's a "sit by the pool" destination either. If you are considering Puerto Rico, I would suggest the Intercontinental San Juan Hotel & Casino, with it's cleaner sea, ocean front pool and accomodating nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: mandalay1971
Reviews.Content: For around $200 a night, this hotel is hard to beat. The staff was excellent! They are very friendly and helpful;made me feel like home. Love the location too; it's right on one of the popular streets in San Juan ,10 minutes to the airport and the beach is in the back yard. Very secured hotel with indoor parking, large pool, bar, variety store, cafeteria and more. Highly recommended, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH better than expected after reading reviews!! long review”
Reviews.Author: kely53
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 nights at ESJ Towers. I read all the reviews on this property and was quite apprehensive as to what we would find. We booked our 3 bedroom/2bath condo from a private owner. We did not book through ESJ Towers so I cannot comment on the units they have available for rent. We knew going in that that this is was not a fancy resort with all of the anemities they have to offer. The location is great. The staff at ESJ Towers were great - couretous, friendly, extremely helpful......they couldnt have been better. The conceirge is open every day until about 9pm. It was an invaluable source of information and help for us. We found the lobby large with lots of seating. My husband spent a fair amount of time using the wireless internet in this area. There were 2 rooms with computers and printers - great for printing out boarding passes or anything else. There is a mini mart on site that has a huge variety of items including beer, wine, liquor- yes they are more pricey than a large food store, but it is very convenient to pick up a thing or two. I had read alot about beach access. It was not a big deal at all. You take an elevator to the parking garage, exit, walk maybe 30 steps to a door (security - you need your room card to exit) that leads to the beach. It is not "dark" during the day as the entrance the cars use to enter the parking garage is right there and lets in LOTS of light. Also the fitness center is located in this area of the parking garagewhere you can also sign out towels and rent beach chairs for $2 . Once you leave the building, you enter a small playground area and a gate to beach access. You punch in a 5 digit code to open gate to beach. This access code was the same the entire time we were there. There was also a securty guard there most of the time checking our names off the list. There is also a man right on the beach in front of ESJ Towers who rents nice beach chairs for $4 a day. Water sports are located very nearby too (jet skiis, banana boats etc). The pool......This area was very nice and large. It had lots of reclining beach chairs. The chairs had cushions on them and towels were always avaialble. We were there over Easter and we were always able to find chairs. There is a small snack stand that sells soda, water, beer, alcohol drinks and hotdogs. There is also a nice bathroom in the pool area. There is security there - a ESJ security guard checks your name on a list and gives you a wrist bracelet. We did not use the restaurant or visit the Mano Mano Lounge. There is a billiard room with 2 pool tables. Also a "card room" with 4 tables. People were using this as a computer room for wireless internet users. The game room had approximately 10 video games in it. You have to pass through a security gate to enter the property. There is also a security person where you park to register etc. He was great! There is also a securty person where you enter the parking garage. This is a very secured property. From what I observed, all of the properties are treated in this way. While some people find this an aggravation. It is done for our safety. This isnt a 5 star hotel or resort. For us, it worked great. We had a nice clean condo with 2 ocean view balconies, washer and dryer 3 tvs etc. Hotel prices in San Juan, especially beachfront, are pricey. I would suggest you research private owners who have property here. Quite often you can see pictures of their units and that is a great help. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again. It isnt the Ritz or the El San Juan......but you arent paying the high prices like you would staying there. We chose it so we could all stay together in one condo as it was a family vacation. We didnt want to stay in a hotel with separate rooms for a week. If you have any questions, send them my way. Karen

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a good value”
Reviews.Author: AisleSeatPlease
Reviews.Content: We booked here when our original hotel turned out to be a complete dump. We were lucky to get anything last minute and overall, we were pleased. This is a combo time share property and hotel. The rooms are very large and include a kitchenette (great if you want to travel cheap and do some meals in), double beds, large bathroom, eating area and balcony with beach views (contrary to one reviewer, I really can't imagine that she didn't have a beach view!). Unlike some reviews, our room was very clean. The ratan furniture and tropical style bedspreads are kind of tacky (think Golden Girls), but no big deal as long as everything is clean. We were first booked on the third floor near the loading dock of the hotel next door. They have deliveries at all hours of the day and night. We were awoken at 2am with them unloading tables and chairs for a large party the next day. Unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked, but they placed us in another room the next morning. So, ask for a room either on an upper floor or at the front of the hotel unless you want to listen to trucks all night. True, you are right next to the airport and some of the planes are loud, but not enough to really bother us...but we live somewhat near an airport too. Unfortunately, even more loud is the air conditioning unit that is on each balcony that makes sitting out on the balcony less than desirable. Not enough to bother sleep, but loud on the balcony. The beach was fantastic and the pool was great. It would be better if there was direct access from the pool to the beach. Vendors are on the beach for chairs, para-sailing and jet skis. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Great parking in an enclosed garage. Near all sorts of restaurants and easy access to the highway for quick trips into San Juan or other parts of the island. We stayed here at a fraction of the cost of close by pricy hotels and simply took advantage of services at other hotels with a short walk (i.e. restaurants, casinos, shopping). Though there is a convenient mini mart in the lobby. We had breakfast at the hotel once (not good) and did not go to the bar or game rooms or onsite gym. For dining, I highly recommend Alfredo's restaurant at the Intercontinental. Somewhat pricy, but great food and great service. Ask to sit outdoors. One down side is that being a time share, most of the residents were older (70s and above) and you again had the feeling you were on an episode of the Golden Girls. This was mostly apparent at the pool vs the beach which was a very mixed crowd. Being ins my 40s and wanting a quiet, relaxing trip, I didn't mind, but my travel companion in his 30s felt awkward. So, it's not the Ritz, but youre not paying the Ritz prices either. Instead, it is a good value for on the beach property, clean rooms, convenient location , friendly staff and lots of in house services.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: karthikb
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in late March 2008, staying at the ESJ towers. Having read the reviews before we left we were not sure what to expect with both the hotel and the staff. But, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The location was excellent. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The hotel had several activity rooms with pool tables, video games, and ping pong tables. It also had about 6 fairly new computers with internet access that can be used as part of the $5/day mandatory resort fee (it covers parking also). The secure access to the beach was not as complicated as some of the reviews had suggested. Also, we realized it was not just for this hotel but almost every hotel and residential buildings along the beach had similar secure controlled access into their properties. We stayed in the 12th floor with great views of the ocean. The only negative thing is the noise from the airport. Being only a couple of miles from the airport planes are constantly taking off. If you are down in the lobby/pool area or in the beach it's not that noticeable but it's pretty loud in the room. The takeoff's stop by around 11 PM, but it does make staying in the balcony in the evenings pretty uncomfortable. Overall I would rate the experience as very good!

Reviews.Title: “needs updated,not hotel”
Reviews.Author: explorer34
Reviews.Content: for over 150$ a night i expect a nice hotel. this hotel was bad. the pro's friendly staff security the cons hotel is extremely old and outdated room had wet/damp smell i saw 1 small cockroach in room charged 2$ a day to use a safe in the room ice maker didnt work and wasnt fixed breakfast buffet was powder eggs and 4 items that were bad parking and beach access was a problem would not stay there again/you shouldnt either

Reviews.Title: “2* hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: denisenbrian
Reviews.Content: we stayed from jan 27 to feb 3. this was a timeshare trade through interval international. first the good stuff. we had an oceanview room on the 12th floor with a beautiful view of the beachline. the beach was very nice and the restaurants and bars in the area were great and reasonable.the pool was very nice. Now the bad. the hotel is in desperate need of repairs. our furniture in the room was worn out. the dresser and bathroom cabinets were made of wicker. water pressure was bad. ceiling leaked in bathroom and on the balcony. when i checked for leak by lifting the ceiling tile i was skocked to see that the ductwork was made of cardboard wraped in ductape, very healthy. i came down with a bad cold, maybe from the air conditioning? the whole building needs to be redone. we took the bus back to isla verde from san juan one day. what an experience. they go right through the roughest and poorest part of town. part of the culture i guess. i would go back to the area but not at esj towers. the intercontinental or the ritz-carlton are the 2 nicest hotels in the area. the el san juan was nice but their casino smells like the carpet had been wet, very musty. taxis are very pushy and expensive

Reviews.Title: “ESJ was excatly what we needed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnie_becka0620
Reviews.Content: we had the best tiome at this hotel. the service was excellent . the view was perfect . room service was not pushy and everyone in the hotel wanted to help us if we needed it . I WILL DEFINITLY BE BACK NEXT YEAR TO STAY AT THE ESJ TOWERS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Outdated Hotel Not A Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Brewster
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our week for this DUMP! The only nice area of this so called resort is the lobby. The units are in BAD need of updating! The view from our unit was of the airport, even though I requested a ocean view. Upon check out they try and hit you with daily charges. Charges for the pool, internet, security and what ever else they can think of. We never used the pool it closes at 7p.m. and I never say any security. Internet service for what I asked I did not bring my laptop. When I refused to pay the fees. I admit had I used or seen a security guard then I would have had no problem. The mgr started yelling at me in spanish and talking to the other lady in spanish. I did remind him that I don't speak spanish. Oh, I also failed to mention the 1st unit they tried to put us in had no door knobs or door locks. The unit we stayed in had no a/c for 2 1/2 days and the stove was @ 30 yrs old only 2 burners worked. I would go back to San Juan but I will stay next door at the San Juan Hotel!! What a beautiful place now that is what a RESORT SHOULD LOOK LIKE!

Reviews.Title: “ESJ is OK”
Reviews.Author: Catsmeow3
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews made me very wary of staying at ESJ, but since I did not make the reservations and was not footing the bill, I figured I'd see it out. My experience ended up being better than what I expected. The decor is out of date. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean enough, nothing scary. The sheets were horribly thin and rough. It is your basic timeshare proptery, nothing upscale, well used. The beach was very nice, though you have to be very careful going in/out the gate. You can easily lock yourself inside it if you don't position it properly before entering the code. People really need to get over complaining about the walk through the garage to the beach entrance. It is not at all bad or long and takes your right by where you get and turn in towels (though I recommend bringing your own beach towel if you want something soft and big). Good restraurnats are few and far between in that area, but Lupi's next door is good and the El San Juan has a little mall-like area with some good food. I did not eat at ESJ's restaraunt or drink at the bar, but others told me the Pina Coladas were great. Having a kitchen area in the room was extremely helpful. I would not mind staying here again, but would probably try to find something a bit nicer first. It served its purpose and the beach and pool were great!

Reviews.Title: “There are better accomodations in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: LPWNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ESJ via a timeshare exchange through Interval International. The common areas in ESJ are clean even though the furnishings need updating. The units themselves are below average. They are clean, we had a room with a balcony overlooking the beach which was fantastic but the kitchens need a complete overhaul. The furniture is outdated and in ill repair. The units really need to be renovated. And, the access to the beach is through the garage which is a little scary when you are alone. During our stay, we experienced small bites on our ankles and lower legs and were afraid they were bedbugs even though we checked the beds thoroughly. The manager assured us that they were not bedbugs but sand fleas which we later found out to be true. He was gracious and sent staff up to our rooms to vaccum, change the linen and we did not have another problem. There are absolutely no amenities at the hotel so you are forced to go to neighboring hotels for fun. We had a WONDERFUL time in Isla Verde...we rented a car and toured Dorado, Loiza, Pinones and took a tour to Bacardi, Old San Juan and other towns. The Metropol Restaurant is the best....in walking distance to ESJ the food is great! And, we had the best Mofongo in another small restaurant in a strip mall near ESJ (cannot remember the name! Sorry!) I heard the Intercontinental is a great hotel to stay in so next time, we will probably go there.

Reviews.Title: “the wosrt hotel in Isla verde, san juan P.R”
Reviews.Author: Kitty808
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel in San Juan, they don't have good actitude, they never smile, never, the people from the parking is the worst, they think that they are the FBI, they don't smile, they never help you, they are very arrogant, they treat you as if you were a criminal, not a guest. Front desk is horible, all the agents there are unfriendly and again they don't smile. Restaurant is good, the people there is friendly, Houskeeping and maintenance is good too. this hotel is horrible, smells bad, have cockroaches in the rooms and in the parking lots. If you are going to travel to P.R please think twice if you are going to this hotel, customer service sucks there, from the minute you enter the hotel, they start to treat you bad!

Reviews.Title: “ESJ is OK”
Reviews.Author: Bosman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ESJ over President's Day week in February '07 and were nervous given some of the very negative reviews on TripAdvisor. Our experience was OK. It was clean, appliances and AC worked fine, beds were comfortable, staff was pleasant and responsive. For the money, our suite was big enough, though not charming. The location is great, you are on the beach and the 25-foot walk through the garage is not that big a deal. Parking was included and we drove around a lot. It's 10-minute drive from the airport. From speaking to other guests, you have to remember that this is a condo building and the quality of the rooms can vary greatly. The management may not be responsible for the upkeep of your room. Also remember, this is an URBAN beach in the middle of a pretty big city, so don't expect serene Caribbean surroundings. So overall, it was very convenient and adequate, but definitely not luxurious or beautiful. You are paying to go to the beach and that's pretty much what you get. Next time, I think we'll try the Courtyard by Marriott down the beach a bit. It looked much newer and very nice. They are going to do construction soon, though, so check on that first.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Towers, an honest review to make your decision easier”
Reviews.Author: cchivian
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was not terrible, nor did it curve my enjoyment in San Juan. There are a few things that i was dissapointed in but I'd rather start off with the positive. I did feel their customer service was great. Nice happy greetings when you enter, cab service at the drop of a dime. At checkin we were told that we had to pay an extra charge of $40.00/room if we wanted maid service. If you choose not to use the maid service you simply have to walk downstairs to trade in old towels for new ones. (as well as sheets and pillowcases) The rooms are a little "out dated" as far as interior design. After a long day of touring around the city i didn't let that bother me. It is a place to lay your head until the next day's long excursion. The pictures on the website speak truly. There is a restaurant called the Happy Apple downstairs, a grocery store, game room with pool tables, a cocktail bar, free internet access room with 3 computers available and a workout room. The Hotels is on one of the most nices beaches, Isla Verde. The water is georgous, blue as blue can be and wonderful sand. There is no bar service so be sure to take a portable cooler down with you. There might be small portables that will sell you drinks but you can always walk about 10-20 feet further down to another hotel who will sell it to you. Here is a list of things you should know: `The Pool closes at 7pm 7 days a week. `There is not beach access from the hotel after 7, I believe b/c of saftey reasons. `you have to walk down the street to find your own beach access after 7pm. (I'm not sure if you can even come back to the hotel beach area) You do have to walk downstairs through the underground parking garage to gain access to the beach, it's not as complicated as others have said. The pool has no swim up bar but a small cabana that sells beer and pina colodas, hot dogs and nachos only. `you do have a small but useful kitchenette, refridgerator, small electric stove, microwave, coffee maker, and average sink. If you are used to luxurious interiors or upscale dining, this is not the place for you. You are next to El San Juan Hotel and Casino & The Intercontinental which is a small walk away. Bus stop is right about a block away. There are small restaurants and a grocery store (puebla) within walking distance I hope this helped! Have fun and enjoy SanJuan!

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Tower and more”
Reviews.Author: Mystrs12
Reviews.Content: ESJ Towers Review Our experience in San Juan, Peurto Rico was invigorating. We stayed in an area called Isle Verdes. ESJ Towers is one of the many resorts located on Isle Verdes. There are a plenty of sightseeing and fun activities to do on this island. It is a US Territory so it has all of the common fast food restaurants like the US such as Subway, Pizza Hut, Dominos, McDonalds, Burger King, etc. There are a number of people who understand and speak English every where that you go. Peurto has a lot to offer a vacationer, but ESJ is no hoopla. There is nothing fancy about this resort hotel. It gives you your minimum accommodations both in the rooms and on the grounds. When you enter the room it has the appliances on one side of the entrance (usually to your left) and enough space to enter with your luggage. The kitchen appliances are aligned next to one another starting with the refrigerator, stove, sink, and counter with microwave and cabinets in your basic white color. Once you walk pass the microwave, youâ€™re in the bedroom similar to an efficiency apt. The furniture is made of wicker (See pictures attached). The room is exactly like the pictures on the webpage online at [--]. There are small rooms off the lobby that houses one of the listed items per room: internet or writing tables, ping pong table and board games, a pool table, a small arcade room, a general store, a bar room, a restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The outdoor pool is located on the second floor. It is nice and clean with a refreshment stand. You canâ€™t use cash at this stand. You have to bill it to your room. You have to walk through a dimly lit parking garage to get to the small gym and beach. You exchange your towels in the gym as well. It has a treadmill, bike, little tv, and free weights. You have to have a pass code to enter the beach. This was the worst feature of the hotel. They should just make steps coming off the pool area so that you can easily get to the beach. It is inconvenient to leave your room on the 8th floor, go to the basement, out the door through the dimly lit parking garage, up some other steps, and punch in your code that you have already forgotten by the time you get to the beach. If your room is in the south building facing the pool and beach, change rooms because it is noisy. The hotel behind you makes deliveries all day and night and uses a crane system to hoist the freights and it is loud. We had to change rooms to the other side of the building to sleep peacefully. They were remodeling some of the rooms beneath us which were noisy, but they worked on the rooms during the day. ESJ has average resort accommodations. There is nothing luxurious or elegant. It is basic and simple in each room. The lobby and pool are its greatest features. I rate the overall hotel a â€œCâ€� average on a grading scale of A-F. I rate the pleasantness of the staff an â€œA-.â€� I rate the location on Isle Verdes a â€œB.â€� The next time that I visit San Juan, I will stay at another resort for the elegance. If youâ€™re in college then it is great, but if you have visited other resorts, it does not come close to a silver or gold star resort. I had mainly three complaints. The noise outside my room from the adjacent hotel delivery system, the hot and cold water knobs had mold and rust around them, and the entrance to the beach being accessed via the parking lot. They accommodated us by moving us to another room. I enjoyed that the resort was located in short walking distance to all restaurants, ATM, block buster, post office, San Juan Hotel with the casino inside, and a 24 hour grocery store, etc. Isles Verdes can use street cleaning, but is tolerable. I believe most people like ESJ because it is close to shopping, restaurants, souvenir shops, Walgreens, a 24-hour grocery store, the beach, public transportation, and tours. Old San Juan is a better looking part of the Island. It reminds you of San Francisco with the hilly streets and it was clean with a lot of historical sites. Here are some of the activities that are a must when you visit Peurto Rico: Bacardi/Old San Juan tour, Rainforest tour, Kayak-Bioluminescence Bay tour, Catamaran Trip, and a ferry or plane ride to Culebra Island. You should do one tour each day so that you can relax by the end of the day and get the busy items out of the way in the beginning of your week. The Bacardi/Old San Juan tour costs $40 per person and includes a tour of the Bacardi Rum Distillery, San Cristobal Fort, and historical sites. The Distillery gives you two free drinks and a movie tour. They stopped the actual walk through of the distillery. (Big disappointment). The Rainforest Tour costs $65 per person which consists of Yokahu Tower, hike to La Mina Rainforest (the more beautiful waterfall). Kayak Bioluminescence Bay tour costs $75 per person. It is a kayak tour that all can enjoy even beginners and non swimmers. You tour a lagoon which has waste deep water that glows a fluorescent green color. Unfortunately, humans have destroyed most of the water so it barely glows, but it is done at night and is a lot of fun (nothing scary). The Catamaran trip costs $65 per person. It consists of sailing, snorkeling, and lunch. Culebra Island Trip is the beach with the white sand, tropical fish, and best beaches. The 16 minute plane ride is only $27 per person and the ferry was $2.50 for a 2 hour ride. You must arrive to the ferry by 6:30 am to get in line to get a ticket if you want the earliest ferry or you may find yourself standing outside in the sun waiting for hours for the next ferry. The plane ride is the better way to travel because itâ€™s less crowded and guaranteed to have space available when you want to leave. The ferry not so much. I hope this was helpful. I encourage others to take the time to print your experience. I gave lengthy details because I did not have many recent reviews before I toured. You can stay at ESJ but donâ€™t expect luxurious rooms. Expect rooms that look like they cost $100 a night not $250 or above. Isle Verdes is one strip with basic shoppingâ€¦no fine dining and a little trashy in spots. Not the entire area. The beach is okay with a lot of seaweed on the shores. Culebra has the best beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great but tolerable”
Reviews.Author: KittyLaReina
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at ESJ. The place is tolerable when no other options are available. Having stayed there 6 yrs ago I knew what to expect when walking into the lobby. Nothing fancy, just some seriously out dated decor. Unlike my first visit to this hotel (which turned out to be quite pleasent) this stay was barely tolerable. Upon entering our room my family and I were greated with a horriblely unpleasent smell. We tried to leave the same day we checked in but most hotels in the area gave us a hassel about reservations and such. When we mentioned the possibility of leaving the hotel they went ahead and charged us for the entire stay. Back to the description of the room...the carpet was littered with black stains and felt slightly damp. When I looked up at the ceiling I noticed many big black spots, what it was I don't think I really want to know. The furniture and decorations were just as outdated as the lobby. The beds were clean but felt as if I were sleeping on a big block of cement. The vanity area in the bathroom was nice and spacious and seperate from the shower and toilet (a nice feature when traveling with family). The balcony and view from the 14th floor were spectacular (about the only good feature of the room). Overall I would Seriously reconsider staying at this hotel. There are many other hotels in the Isla Verde area (if that is where you wish to stay) and even more thoughout San Juan. I do not think my family and I will stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: springlakeac
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our third trip to ESJ Towers in San Juan, PR. We were there over Easter vacation. Everything you need is here - beach, gym. restaurants, market, computer room, easy access to airport, readily accessible cabs. and best of all great weather and people. Where can you go, right on the beach, for an economical rate. My family will be returning for many years to come. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: grovepoint
Reviews.Content: Not sure what many of you expected. As far as I know, the ESJ Towers is not a hotel. It's rental condos. The pool was great. Had a well furnished two bedroom, two bath, condo with my kids. We all had our space. A hotel on the beach would have cost me two to three times as much for a room with two beds. Compare the prices next door at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino or the Intercontinental Hotel. The location was very convenient and away from the real crowds of San Juan beach strip. Actually, we spent very little time in the condo as it was, preferring to be on the beach, pool or taking on other activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: ESJ Towers is very basic. Small rooms, nothing special. Have to walk to beach through underground parking. Bottom floor rooms are depressing. Time share sellers bug you with telephone calls and coupons left outside the room. Isla Verde is not very nice, crummy beach and no charm. No decent restaurants nearby, just a bunch of chain restaurants and fast food restaurants along the seedy road behind the hotel. You need to go into San Juan to get a decent meal. We were there for 2 nights and 1 day on our way to Tortola, and would have been better off staying in Old Town where we could go to nice restaurants. Overall, a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Smelly, Rude”
Reviews.Author: Taurus08
Reviews.Content: I am actually baffled at the moment and don't know where to begin. I checked into ESJ on Thursday evening 3/8/2007 at 3:00am. After a long exhausting trip all I wanted to do was sleep. Sleep was the last thing I got to do at this facility. When I opened my hotel room door...My mouth dropped. The carpets were covered in filthy stains and there was food on the floor. The room reaked of filth. I was actually scared to lay in the bed, but at 3:00am I had no other choice. I got some towels and spread them on the bed and attempted to sleep. 7:00am....Ring Ring Ring......Prank phone calls to my room Non Stop!!!! Clank Clank Clank....SLAM!!! I look out the window to see what the racket was. Unbelieveable! I am in a room directly above DUMPSTERS!!! And Yes, they were extremely active and slammed constantly. I saw and heard enough. I went to the manager wanting to check out of the hotel and I was told NO! I refuse to stay in such filth and be treated so unfairly, so I checked out anyway.... And yes, I was charged regardless of my non stay in the room. Please, do yourself a favor and consider something else. Trust me. The two pictures I have are from the room and taken with my camera phone. If I would have had a camera I would have shown more disasterous photos.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our needs”
Reviews.Author: tennisplayersuffern
Reviews.Content: We stayed in ESJ Towers at the end of January. We wanted a place that would accomodate our family comfortably (2 adults, a 12 year old and a 16 year old), have kitchen facilities, be conveniently located, have some resort amenities, and be reasonably priced. ESJ towers met these needs. We booked through a realtor and were very satisfied withour 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. The apartment was very clean, was decorated attractively, had plenty of clean towels and linen, and a kitchen fully equipped with dishes and appliances. We even had a washing machine and dryer in our unit. I think the condition and decor of the units vary, but we lucked out. The pool was nice with plenty of lounge chairs surrounding it and a hot tub nearby. The pool was a plain shaped pool without fancy landscaping, but it was a nice size and clean and there was a kiosk by the pool which served pretty good drinks. Plenty of towels were available for quests at the pool and at the fitness center. The beach was nice except that for part of our stay there was a lot of sea weed in front of our hotel. It was not only our hotel, but some of the adjacent fancier resorts also had the same problem. The staff at ESJ were very helpful and friendly. The staff at the front desk, the concierge, the minimart and the restaurant were all very friendly and accomodating. My children enjoyed the ping-pong tables, the game room and the pool tables during our stay. I was glad to see that the hotel offered internet service 24/7 at no extra cost to its guests. The location of ESJ was central to a lot of the tourist sites in Puerto Rico as well as casinos, golf courses and night life. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to families who are looking for a nice, convenient place to stay with the understanding that the facilities are not fancy, resort level facilities. We would consider a return trip to ESJ Towers in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BeachloverBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long vacation at the Esj towers. After reading some of the more recent reviews on this site, we approached the vacation with trepidation. I'm glad to report that our accomodations were much better than expected and that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We rented a 2 bedroom condo through a private realtor, Palm View Realty. The agent, Alma, was helpful in securing apartments for my family as well as my sister's family. The apartments were spacious , clean and well maintained, even if they were somewhat old. We had a nice balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean. We did not have any maid service for the week and I felt our unit could have been provided with more clean towels but this is variable from unit to unit as my sister's apartment was very well supplied. We found the hotel pool to be very nice. Although not as fancy as a resort style pool, it was fairly large and very clean. There were plenty of lounge chairs available and a kiosk from which to buy drinks. The beach in front of the hotel was nice but unfortunately, there was a lot of seaweed in the water and we had to walk down the beach a distance in order to find clearer water in which to swim. The access to the beach from the hotel was through the parking garage but this was a short walk and no big deal. There was a boat rental stand on the beach right in front of the hotel where we were able to rent jet skis or go out in a banana boat. We found the workers in the hotel to be very pleasant, especially the host in the restaurant from which I bought coffee every morning. The hotel had a game room, pool tables, ping pong tables, a business center and a decent fitness center. Although not luxurious, we found this to be avery comfortable and convenient place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little help!”
Reviews.Author: Califcutie
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our 5 star timeshare to stay at the ESJ Towers Jan 10-17, 2007. My husband and I are very accustomed to staying at nice places through our timeshare company and we love Puerto Rico but ESJ really needs a little help! Our unit was a studio facing the beach--the view was great but the room wasn't very clean, the water in the shower was lukewarm-cold most of the time, the "clean" glassware in the kitchenette had lipstick marks, the mattresses were worn to the point that sheets of wood had been placed between the mattress and the box springs to add support and the pillows were mostly lumps of cotton. ESJ charges for everything--beach chair rentals as well as laundry which we were not accustomed to with timeshare exchange. We did not get maid service during our week and had to take our dirty towels for exchange each day. No VCR or DVD in the room but many cable tv channels were provided. On the plus side, the front desk staff were all very nice as well as the concierge. The man that runs the small store was great and always had a smile. The best part about ESJ Towers is the location--great beach, right in Isla Verde near restaurants and close to Old San Juan. We attended a timeshare presentation and asked if they were planning to update the hotel and the answer was "NO!" Our owners like the "retro feel of the place." The lobby is very nice and has lots of great artwork and is kept very clean. We will go to San Juan again at some point in time but we'll try not to stay at ESJ Towers.

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: carribian
Reviews.Content: I want to start off my criticism by telling you that I am not a hard person to please, and that I am generally very tolerant of bad service. Esj towers is on a very beautiful beach. The rooms here at the towers all have very nice views. The building looks absolutely beautiful from a distance. It takes a good picture is what I am trying to say. And that is about all the nice things that I can say. I am not usually dissatisfied with a hotel or condo, but this place had so many bad things about it that I had to review. DO NOT BOOK HERE!!!! YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED. I have stayed in hotels in Jamaica, St. Martin, Aruba, and finally here. I paid by far the most money to stay here, and was the least satisfied. This place is mainly a time share rental. This place is a horribly run down. It is all old people here. I felt like I was staying in a nursing home. No activities (accept bingo). Here is what I saw that was so bad. The restaurant (Happy Apple) has horrible food. Soggy hash browns, tasteless eggs, I could go on for a while. The happy apple has a leak in the roof, and their solution is a bucket. The ceiling panels are falling apart/discolored. Nothing was good about this restaurant. The service at the front desk has an attitude that they just donâ€™t care. Check in took 2 hours. Maid service did not come every day. 2 out of the 6 elevators did not work. If you are a guest you have to park your car in a dungeon. THERE IS NO BEACH ACCESS FROM LOBBY. YOU HAVE TO GO THROUGH THE PARKING GARAGE (DUNGEON). Every room has their ac unit on the back porch, and they are loud and windy. (My towel blew off the balcony). The shower only had cold water in my friendâ€™s room. Everything smells. This place is in terrible need of a makeover. There are many other things but I am just tired of writing. DONâ€™T BOOK HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kp0826
Reviews.Content: ESJ was the absolute worst place I have stayed - dirty, outdated, dirty beach and crowded, gross pool. This may be an OK place for college spring breakers who only need a bed, but not for anyone who cares about cleanliness or atmosphere. We had to lug beach chairs through a metal turnstyle. We found a live cockroach in our kitchenette (and got no reaction whatsoever from the manager, except that this is common) - absolute disgust. I still can't get over it.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster.”
Reviews.Author: MandoB
Reviews.Content: It's been four years since we stayed here, and we still haven't gotten over it. This was the most disgusting and outdated hotel I have ever stayed in. First of all, it is not even a hotel, the rooms are rented as apartments to residents of San Juan. The odors in the halls were enough to make me break down in tears as we entered. The pool closed at 6:00 p.m. The rooms were dirty and small. The restaurant was a joke. The "bar" was an even bigger joke. As I read some of the other reviews, I am perplexed. I suppose the people who like this hotel are those on a budget, with kids, who just want a place to sleep. And, yes, they do have beds. However, if you want even the bare minimum you would expect from any hotel, you will be extremely disappointed with ESJ Towers. In closing, my husband and I stayed at this hotel for free as it was part of a time-share. Even so, we left the day we arrived and booked a room at another hotel. It was so bad that we wouldn't even stay here for free.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: thebighd
Reviews.Content: Returned from ESJ Towers last week after a five night stay. Found it to be a good place to stay for the rate charged. It was not a resort type hotel, but met our needs by offering a nice beach, convenient walk to a variety of restaurants and other hotel/casinos. I found the accommodations to be clean. The fitness center was above average for a hotel fitness center which was great for a fitness nut such as myself - found the area around the hotel to be safe for walking day and night with a variety of things to do in the neighborhood. Also the bus was easy to use to go into Old San Juan if you choose - it took approximately 1/2 hour by bus and was worth the trip. The biggest negative about it not being a resort type hotel was it was difficult to get food or drinks at the beach - you had to travel out of the hotel and onto the main strip area. All in all it was a good place to stay if you are looking for a no frills hotel on a nice beach in a nice area. Definitely visit the Ritz-Carlton - worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the right type vacationers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I appreciate the reviews but more often than not, they don't offer enough insight. ESJ is a very good vacation spot depending on your group - I'll get back to that below. Based on our room, the rooms are similar to a good hotel room and include a large bathroom/vanity area and a decent sized kitchen. Sure ther's some wear and tear to the rooms but it's not blatantly obvious - you'll notice little things over the course of a week but nothing that is a concern. The amenities are decent: convenience store, okay concierge, adequate workout room, decent sized pool, and beach access. The pool is a standard rectangle and while the pool area is nice it's not resort level. It does get 8 ft deep and it's a large pool. There's beach access that you have to get to through the garage - it's about a 60 second walk once you exit the elevator. It's inconvenient but not an issue. When you do access the beach, you are at the east end of about a 2 mile stretch of beach. A short walk further east and you have access to about another 2 miles. Get a room facing west if possible. The west side balaconies over look the pool and has a great view of about 1.5 miles of beach. The view on the east side is of a small neighborhood and beyond that you can see about another mile of beach. ESJ is located in Isle Verde next to the El San Juan and Intercontinental properties. So the immeadiate area is great. The other resorts actually encourage you visit them. Once you walk from the hotel to the main road (maybe 1/4 mile), you can walk the mainstreet for probably about a mile east and 2 west. Ther you can walk to Metropol, Edith's, Mi Casita, Lupis, the grocery stores, Walgreens, a few bars and other stores. The place is a buzz at nighttime - and I always felt safe. So it's the good room facilities and the great location that I give ESJ a good review. My only negatives are the pool closes at 7 PM and there's no real pool side bar (they have a kiosk they pass off as one). I think teenagers may get a little bored at the site. Younger children would be fine. Adults traveling alone would be great. But if you're more into facilities as many are this may not be the best place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ponymoee
Reviews.Content: We just returned 3/14 from San Juan after a 5 night stay at the ESJ Towers. The hotel may not be the fanciest on the beach but the location and the staff make the difference. From check in to departure everyone was helpful and most pleasant. Our room was clean and very well maintained. The view from the 8th floor toward the beach was excellent. You do have to walk through the parking garage and a gate to the beach but there are no roads to cross. The pool area and whirlpool were well kept and the fitness center had great equipment. Parking is free at ESJ which is somewhat of a rarity in San Juan. The hotel was relativly quiet and all in all a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “great weather”
Reviews.Author: Pugsley307
Reviews.Content: we are spending this week here at the ESJ towers. Our room overlooks the ocean and pool. I have found the staff to be polite. The rooms STILL could use an updating but this is certainly not the worst timeshare swap we've done. the weather is great. One point is we rented a car and the in-door parking here at the ESJ is complimentary, from what I see walking around here, thats worth well over a $100 for aweek.The room is a studio type with a full stove and refrigerator. There are many places to eat within a 10 minute walk. There are casinos in the two hotels next door (El San Juan and intercontinental)the noise level is acceptable mostly older couples like us - a few children, all seem well behaved. all in all not the ritz but not the $$$$$ either. ed

Reviews.Title: “Back again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has a time share and I first used it in April of 2003, stayed two weeks and had a great time. Bought some 12 days from another persons time share this past (2005) Thanksgiving week, again great time. Had my niece this time and we were having such a fun vacation that my sister inlaw flew down Thanksgiving Day! Going Back April 2006 renting a car again and doing it all over!! Everything is here, nearby casinos,the beach within 3 minutes, bus to Old San Juan etc etc etc........

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not too thrilled about the style. very 80ish However, the customer service and ammenities were superb. We would return in a second. The view is just breathtaking, you couldn't ask for a better location and minutes from Old San Juan. - yet you feel like you are lost in paradise. a good thing! I would recommend to everyone. It will be one of your greatest memories.

Reviews.Title: “Many time guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has owned time share at the ESJ Towers since the early 80s, and I am thrilled to making a return to the property with my husband and son this month. I have always loved it there. No, it is not fancy, but it right on the beach, has a great pool, and a wonderful, friendly staff. As a previous reviewer said, everything you need from fancy restaurants to clubs and entertainment are right outside the door. Give the ESJ Towers a try for a nice, clean, reasonably priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ESJ Towers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a time share. It is not luxurious in any way but it is the best! It is located on Isla Verde one of the best beaches of Puerto Rico. You can walk onto the beach barefoot! Ritz-CaArlton and Marriott can't say the same. The hotel has wonderful views of the ocean! My husband and I have been there for 3 years straight and love it. There is also a fridge and stove and all amenitites. The pool is very large and wondeful most afternoons there play bingo and give away prizes such as money, drinks and liquor. It is wonderful! Please don't listen to all the negative feedback! Perfect for the price! Please email me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, My name is Karen Smith and I spent a week at the ESJ tower and it was wonderful the people are friendly and welcoming. I would definetly go back to ESJ. The only draw back is that the hotel and beach is lacking entertainment there should be music playing or something. As for the hotel it is really dead in side. I expected to hear some sort of music. I think management need to look in to that. Other than that it was great. Karen A. Smith

Reviews.Title: “nice place to come home to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i go to esj every year on a relatives time share and yeah the place is outdated and doesn't have a 4 star restaurant but thats not important to me. if you go out the door there is everything you can imagine outside, fine dining, spelunking, hang gliding snorkling diving, clubs, casinos, just evrything, and when you want to come home to relax you just come back to esj and you have a nice quite lobby with staff that know you and its just relaxing. the casino next door is nice but i like coming home for the night and not schlepping through a casino with dolled up ladies. the restaurant is not that bad either, good burgers, if you want a steak or sushi go outside. if you want to go clubbing go outside, if you want a nightcap when you get home go to the mano a mano lounge, i think its great. i would say its a nice casual place for families or relaxed couples.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place to Visit!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ESJ in April of 2004. I was, at first, a bit skeptical about how good the accomodations would be when I entered the lobby, which had a 1960s motif. However, my reservations were quickly put to rest. I found the ESJ Towers to be a really nice place with clean rooms and the added feature of efficiency kitchens. The beach is absolutely beautiful and the pool and hot tub are both well maintained and not very crowded. I would definitely visit the ESJ again.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from PR 2 weeks ago, and i had an amazing time. we stayed the ESJ towers, and at first when i came in i was a little taken back with the outdated design of the lobby, however, the rooms were great and comfertable. I must say that the staff was great, so helpful and so friendly. the pool was a lot of fun, bingo was fun, but hotel should maybe have more activities rather then just bingo. the location was fantastic, walking distance to everything. beach access was great. just the cleaning service was not great, i stayed in the time share, and i found out that cleaning service was for regular guests only, which was shocking and dissapointing. the resturant only offered breakfast and lunch with a very limited menu options, however, the staff at the resturant were so nice, and even thought the food was just okay, i kept on coming there for breakfast every morning just because i loved the staff at the resturant. but the rooms were very spacey and nice, and the hotel generally was great and accomadating. i would defenitly return to ESJ towers, unless of course i get a chance to stay at the hotel next door!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SenaW
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the El San Juan Towers over New Year's Eve this year. We had traded our time share and were a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. Our room was lovely - with a new kitchen, terrace with ocean view. The staff at the hotel were always helpful and available and set a very nice atmosphere. On New Years Eve they provided snacks and hats and noisemakers at the bar. We needed to pay when we wanted the room cleaned. The location is great (lots of hotel and restaurants within walking distance). The pool area was fine and not so crowded that you needed to worry about getting a seat. My only real complaint was that the access to he beach is extremely awkward and you need to carry out beach chairs through the garage (therefore we really did not spend time there). We felt as a time share trade we got terrific value during a very expensive week to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Our first two week vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from ESJ in San Juan on March 5th 2005. I had read some previous reviews and was a little nervous because they were not complimentary. I have to honestly say my husband and I found ESJ to be Fantastic. Everyone from the manager on down was wonderful. The rooms were clean and had everthing in them you could want. Absolutely no bugs.If you needed anything we just called and they were more than happy to oblige. The pool was awesome, the beach was great, the location fantastic. I would return to ESJ in a heartbeat. We cannot say enough good things about our vacation there. I left my hat there and would you believe they FED-EX it to my home. Way To Go! ESJ Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned and already miss the great weather”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from sunny PR where we stayed at the towers. Our efficiency room was clean although a bit dated. Check in was smooth and the staff was very helpful throughout our stay. Every room has their own air conditioning compressor on the balcony and that coupled by a close proximity to the airport created slightly elevated sound levels that we got used toquickly. Also, we spent most of our time at the pool and walking the lovely beachfront where non of that mattered. The pool is not heated and was "refreshing" when you first get in. The hot tub was HOT. Some residents seem to really like it hot, personally we found it delightful first thing in the morning. Since this was a prime time (President's week) we thought it might be difficult to get a lounge chair but we never had a problem. We only had one request to visit their timeshare offerings (just a note on the door) and we were not "bothered" for the rest of our stay. We skipped their restaurant which serves breakfast and lunch only to explore some other local spots within walking distance. First class restaurants like "The Palm" are right next door for dinner out but we often cooked our own meals (note: great grocery store 3 blocks away) prior to going "out." Powered water activities are available on the beach (separate vendor) and tours can be arranged. An air conditioned bus ride to Olde San Juan will only cost you 25 cents each way but cabs are ready to take you anywhere. Overall we had a great time away from all the snow here in NY. While not a 5star resort, worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: citygirl211
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip from Puerto Rico. And I have to say that after reading all the reviews on the tripadvisor on this place I was very skeptical and worried about my reservations here. Needless to say this is by far the best place to stay. I have stayed at the radisson ambassador and this tops the radisson . I mean the view alone was incredible!!!! Even on a booked weekend they were able to accomadate me in a room with the most spectacular view of the ocean . Its near all the big hotels where there is alot of partying going on . The Mano a Mano lounge makes the best Pina Coladas I was there every night. The kitchenette was extremely clean. I was traveling with an infant so I was worried about the whole bugs issue I read about on the other reviews... NO BUGS at all !!! Everyone there treated us so well !! We are even considering buying time share here because we enjoyed so much. So if your looking for something econmical near all the party hotels or maybe like me where you are traveling with family and need the convenience of having a small kichenette this is the place to be !! they even had high speed internet . I can't say anything bad about this place it was by far the best and I have traveled to Puerto rico several times .. I highly reccommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a week or two.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am glad that we did not read the reviews. ESJ was a decent place to stay for a week or two for vacation. The pool and beach access were great. Parking was okay. The location in Isla Verde is close to the airport, major highways and shopping and food establishments. The building is a little outdated, but clean and nice. The rooms were nice too. The best thing about ESJ was the staff. Everyone was friendly, helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Oh boy! What can I say about this Hotel!!!???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon in August 2004. My aunt decided to give us 7 days at a hotel that her timeshare covered. The hotel was ESJ. Compared to some of the other hotels on the strip it was nice. When we got in it was dimly lit and had a 70s flare to it. It was kind of run down and disturbing. Checking in was a breeze. The color of the lobby was orange and brown. You can't get anymore 70s than that. We we went up to our room and it was alright. Our view of the beach was magnificent! We were on the 11th floor (I think) and had the best view of the beach. We had a balcony with 2 beach chairs and a round table. The bathroom was spacious. The sink and drawers were across from the closet and were separated from the toilet and shower. The toilet and shower along with shelving area was in a different room. Different but nice. The restaurant in the hotel had the same old buffet breakfast every morning. They switched it up twice while we were there. I was getting sick of waffles, eggs, and hashbrowns. Forget dinner. The restaurant was closed at 2pm!!! So you had to truck through San Juan to get food. I was never too disappointed though. There's burger king, dominos, chinese food, mexican restaurants, PR restaurants, papa johns... Food places everywhere. Plus the 4-star hotels are next door with excellent restaurants. The biggest downside was the fact that no one in 7 days changed ouor sheets, towels, toilet paper. If you are part of the Time share program side of the hotel you have to do everything yourself. If you are just staying there as one of their regular guests then I would think they would have daily maid service! If I were to visit PR again I would never think about ESJ Towers. Even if they do change my sheets everyday! the beach- EXCELLENT the hotel- NEVER AGAIN! Email me if you have Qs

Reviews.Title: “not exactly paradise in isla verde”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my friend and i went down to puerto rico for vacation in december 2003 (i know this is a bit overdue, but better late than never) boy were we surprised when we arrived. it looked like the hotel was never updated from the 70s! the place smelled old and the rooms looked just like regular hotel rooms, not suites like we were expecting. we were on the 3rd floor and our view was of the apartments (which i later found out were expensive homes) next door to the hotel. we were given a tour of the grounds, which didnt last long. we realized that the most of the "amenities" were actually featured at the hotel next door! the pool area was ok. there was a big bin for clean towels and a bin for dirty towels... which was which, im still not sure. the staff was ok. the concierge was pretty helpful. we did get to go on a couple of tours while there. the best one was the snorkeling!!! the place was centrally located. on our first night we found the wendys, burger king, and the walgreens. it was almost like we never left home! in all, id say i wouldve rather stayed at the embassy suites or even the hotel next door than to ever book a room at the esj towers again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a dump but close to it!! Very Simple!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. Let me start by saying I stayed here with my Husband and daughter in August because my mother in law, sister in law, father in law, cousins of them and basically the entire damn inlaw family wanted to show me where they go every year and took my husband since he was a child. They have timeshare here and to me thats why they rant and rave of it... either that or the other reason well known... they don't know class or come anywhere near it! The hotel itself is HORRIBLE! Seriously listen to me... HORRIBLE! I am not some person who uses the words superb or has to have to true luxury either! I'm 26 and from brooklyn so i am well down to earth. First off there is no I repeat no where good to eat in this hotel! There is 1 restaurant open for breakfast that is GROSS!!!! As for the pool the only food at the tiny little bar there (no swim up) is a hot dog or yogurt! the hot dog is good. The pool was ok. An average pool. To be honest not too shaby for the hotel but no swim up bar, and rude kids everywhere! The rooms are eh... they are simple. 2 queen beds and a balcony. bathroom small and like any normal bathroom. The room wasn't gross or dirty. It was just not my taste... it was plain and simple. there is nothing else to describe there cause there is nothing else to do. They have an arcade and a lobby lounge (boring). PS everyone can not be in the lobby past 12:00. that was no biggie to me cause i didn't want a part of the lobby. Anyway as for Puerto Rico itself it really is beautiful. Don't dare compare it to Jamaica cause it blows Jamaica away. I EXTREMLY RECOMMEND the hotel next door!!! 7 star resort +++ in my book....The El SAN JUAN WYNDHAM!!!!! We ate there almost every night. LA PICCOLA FONTANA IS AMAZING!!!! 4 diamond award there! Also The Steakhouse there left of Fontana is GREAT!! Other restaurants that were AMAZING was MOMOYAMA! Japanese steakhouse that I HIGHLY RECOMMEND! BEST JAPANESE STEAKHOUSE I EVER ATE AT!!! Its in the continental hotel which is in walking distance about two blocks to the right of esj. Also very good was RUTH CHRIS STEAK HOUSE! It was right there next door to MOMOYAMA! write these down cause you will thank me! In the RITZ CARLTON HOTEL MY HUSBAND AND I LOVED THE VINEYARD!!!! Excellent lobster and steak!!!!! Amazing appetizers!!! Beautiful restaurant. My husband surprised me with a GORGEOUS diamond ring there. THE FOOD WAS TO DIE FoR and i am from New York and its hard to impress me with food! I love to eat...surprises me i am only 120 pounds cause I eat like an animal and only quality food! The casino in the Wyndham is GREAT! HUGE AND WONDERFUL!!!! The bars in the wyndham are great and NEVER dead! Also try senior frogs to go out at night.. GREAT BAR!!! If you like clubs go to the one in the wyndham... ITS AWESOME! true new york feeling! One day we went and took the barefoot catermeran trip... IT went to a private island off PR called la verde and we went snorkeling and had a great beach! the lunch buffet was great!!! great selection all included with open bar! They played music and you could take the sun on the way there! It was great. Another day we went to the town old san juan... Was so nice! They had so many shops from guess to coach to shop in and great spanish restaurants with cobble stone streets and a view from the park of the entire island! so nice! We ate in an amazing spanish restaurant that wasn't expensive at all... i forgot the name but it was on the block of the park! Last restaurant on the right. Also from here they have a night cruise that goes around the island that has live music and open bar for 12 bucks! ALL in ALL I had a great time! PR was great...AS for the ESJ towers spend the extra 40 a night and go next door!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews about the ESJ Towers and are glad we did not listen to them. Just spent a week there and had a great time. The place was very clean and the staff was the best we have encountered in our 10 years of timeshares and exchanges. The building is older, but the maintenance staff are always working as is housekeeping. Has a great pool and is located on a nice strip of beach. The restaurant could use more of a variety, but there are several nice restaurants located nearby and in the nearby casino's. Would not hesitate to recommend the ESJ Towers to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Riding out Jeanne!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at the ESJ Towers at the tail end of Jeanne.. we were not sure if we would make it in. After arriving a day after the storm, we were greeted to no power on the island, however, the ESJ towers has a generator, and power in the common areas. There was also water available. Just 2 days in, power was restored, and all was well. The staff was friendly, and the hotel was convenient, and secure. Sure, it is not a modern, 5 star hotel, but the location is great, and I would definetly return!

Reviews.Title: “Survived Hurricane Jeanne at ESJ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to San Juan for a week and on the day we were to leave Hurricane Jeanne hit the island. As our flight was cancled we stayed on at ESJ for another two days and watched the storm go thru from our balcony. The staff at ESJ was very helpful and accomodating. The hotel has its own generators, so we had electricity in the common areas of the hotel, even though the individual rooms did not. ESJ also has a big water tank so all rooms had water. The island had no electricity or water and we heard it could be 2 to 3 weeks before power and water would be restored to all parts of the island after this storm. Also, the ESJ people kept the little resturant open with a terrific buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner and a limited menu. And the mini mart in the hotel was kept open with other food and supplies. We thought the ESJ was in a good location, the beach was beautiful and well kept, the hotel (though old) was extremely clean and pleasant, and the staff was wonderful. We would definately stay at the ESJ again. Also, Puerto Rico is an interesting island with many places to visit, and the people were very friendly everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The esj Towers is a good place to stay its located in carolina Puerto Rico which is an upscale tourist area. I cant believe the nasty reviewes I am reading here. I own time share and I visit often .Trust me the place is not bad. Its designed for the budget minded traveler. If you want an upscale hotel that will cost you 500$ to 1,000 per night try the Hotel EL Conquistatdor

Reviews.Title: “The last resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After only staying one night in this hotel, I came to realize that I should have spent $300 extra dollars and stayed somewhere else. The furniture was old wicker, the carpeting was from the 70's, the bathrooms were dirty, The remote controls did not work, and it took forever to figure out how to use the shower. This is a converted apartment complex, that is offering the rooms as time shares. If you pay more than $100 US dollars a night here, you're crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ESJ in June 2000. With my mom and my 2yr old son. We had no trouble at check in. The location is excellent and close to everything, including public transportation if your not driving. The rooms are large and clean, but the kitchen needed some updating, Stove & Frigde were old. The pool and the childrens play ground were awesome. If you dont want any glits and glamour and are bringing your family, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a week at the ESJ. While not the most modern facility, it was clean and well managed. After addressing the staff about other guest being too noisy, they immediately handled the problem with no other disturbances. The bathroom and beds need updating, but all in all we had a good time for the money. While we had a view of townhouses below us, our friends had a wonderful view of the beach. The air conditioners on the balcony make enjoying the evenings almost impossible. However, I would do it again. Didn't spend much time there except at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed Apil 9, 2004 - April 26, 2004, Excellent!! The staff was very professional and curteous. I especally give thumbs up to Pablo at the Front Desk. The property was clean as well as the rooms. Yes to somewhat I agree that the room are a little old fashion, however very clean and comfortable. I can't understand why some of the comments, I guess you just can't satisfy everyone. For the price, how could anyone complain. Location was also great.......I'd stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ was different”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thing the ESJ is a average Hotel. I went during Memorial Weekend last year and i had the crappiest room there. my view was of the balconey of the window that lead to the pool and garbage men and dumbster. Restaurant less then average and the pool was pretty nice. Staff was friendly. Im planning on going again but not staying at the ESJ Tower.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ Towers is a great little secret!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are not luxurious they are well maintained and the kitchenette, with a full size refridgerator, can not be beat! The property itself is the best part. Travelling with children (6 & 8 yrs) I was concerned about security, The card lock system was used to access all areas on the property. The bar.lounge and restuarant only accepted room sales, no cash sales so the general public is not permitted on premises unless acoompanied by guests. The restaurant menu needs a major overhaul. The staff was absolutely wonderful. By the end of the week I felt like they were family. Lots for the children to do with a the pool room, arcade room and ping pong table room.
