I recoomend the front desk keep family friendly videos on hand because they had a perfect video room (formerly the toddler play area). The pool and beach access was convenient. I defintely recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Esj Towers was great for location, the check-in was fast. Staff are really helpful with the exception of the maids, we were there for 1 week and NEVER had our room cleaned... We had to get our own linens, towels etc. They all had attitude.... The rooms were in need of modernizing. But all in all I would stay here again, the rooms have a city view, or ocean view, small kitchenette & HUGE king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ was the Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In Feb. 2000, We were here for 2 days & one night (after our Cruise Ship docked,) but it was one of the highlights of our trip! After 7 Days on a ship it was great to unwind a bit and walk on solid ground @ this great Hotel. The best surprise of all when upon checking in, they decided to upgrade us to a Suite.......! And WOW, what a SUITE, the ocean view was fabulous & falling asleep to the sound of the Atlantic waves was mesmerizing. (Can't open a porthole on a cruise ship for that sound!) Nobody pressured us about 'timeshares' or anything. It was the best night and days we could've asked for. Their staff was friendly and helpful from beginning to end. The great Puerto Rican resturants (like the Palms) were within walking distance and checking out was a sad day for us. We hated to leave our great Suite to head back for the cold and snowy Philadelphia weather! We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “so old fashion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: okay i just came back from pr and we stayed at the esj tower the location is great but the hotel it self is very old fashion its needs serious renovation,and the rooms are okay but the bathroom fixtures most be from 1980's.the only good thing is that it was valentine weekend so me and fiance didn't really care because we were to busy???? but that was my second time in pr and my third time will not be at the esj tower belive me....

Reviews.Title: “OK, Location and staff are what you should focus on.”
Reviews.Author: NAMLuvs2Go
Reviews.Content: We just returned the 3rd of Feb. After a week there we were ready to explore other places. The big problem we found was the restaurant/diner. We had "breakfast" our first morning there and never returned. They only served till 2:00, so that meant no room service for dinner. Not that you'd want to with the quality of food, but it would be nice to have the option. We have a 3 year old, so in-room dining is helpful. The pool was nice, the beach was close/on-site and secure. The staff was nice and extremely helpful. Free parking- a bonus in Isla Verda. As for the building itself it looks like that tried to maintain the original decor from the 70s. Everything was clean, which is important, but definitely not newer. I'm not sure we'll return to San Juan, but I'm sure if we do we more than likely won't stay at the ESJ- unless we cannot find another exchange.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ESJ is an average hotel. The staff is super friendly. While in San Juan I did two Wyndhams. The Wyndhams were nicer, but more expensive. The good things about ESJ were the prices, location, view of the beach and city, mini-mart (prices), and again, the staff. The negatives were that you don't get the "extra" things you get from a hotel and don't feel as don't feel as cozy. The restaraunt was not the greatest, but decent.We did not see any bugs.All in all, a decent place. If it's your honeymoon, splurge and stay somewhere nicer.Lastly, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ruin Your PR Trip.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok whatever you do, you dont want to ever stay at the ESJ towers. This place is an absolute dump!!! I wouldn't even stay there again if they offered to pay me!!! During my stay, The electric went out for one full day, the rooms were dirty, scattered bugs. I mean, if you like school lunch, then you will enjoy the food there...its disgusting. Now I must say. The staff is very nice and even personable. The pool is ok but not what you expect when vacationing in PR. Parking was absolutle NIGHTMARE!!!! Yes this hotel is located on the beach, which is nice, BUT these beaches are nothing compared to ones a little bit out of the touristy area. I loved PR, it was truley a great place just dont ruin it by staying in the ESJ Towers.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the ESJ in San Juan for 3 months, while working down there. The people were very helpful and friendly. The location and the view from my room was great. I still have a picture hanging in my office now, so I can imigage I was there. I don't think the ugle comments are justified, but comfort above prestige is what I look for. I would love to be able to go back.

Reviews.Title: “ESJ fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we just got back from 10 days in Puerto Rico at ESJ towers. We found the staff very friendly, the place clean, but yes somewhat outdated. The location was great. The beach was very nice. Edward the chair rental guy very accomodating. Tried the pool, it was adequate and clean. Lots of older folks here so it's quiet (but we like that). We had a rental car for th 10 days we were there. Driving in San Juan area was extremely congested and you have to watch time of day for access to highways. Drivers are very aggressive. Once out in the country, it was fine. We liked visiting the smaller coastal towns, very beautiful with nice beaches. We found parking inside ESJ easy and at no additional cost. It's an easy walk to other hotels and restaurants. We liked Lupis next door, view from Blue Dolphin great but food so-so. Try the Honk Kong restaurant in El san Juan next door, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what an awful awful place. Nobody should ever go to this place even if it was the last place on earth to stay. It is an excuse for a hotel and is a total joke!!! By far, the worst thing ive ever seen in my life. I would not stay here if you paid me 1000 a night.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the esj for three months came home for a month and then went back and stayed another month. I was working all over the island after a hurricane, so at the end of a day bone tired the staff always made sure I received all I asked for .As far as I am concerned its hats off to ESJ TOWERS.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: dfehr123
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the ESJ towers. I have to agree with thr negative reviews of the place. We were on the 10th floor and had a one bedroom apartment. We had tiny gnat-like bugs; first noticed them in the kitchen, then in the bathroom and all along the doorways in the hall. Just kept finding more and more. They were harmless, though, bought a can of Raid in the mini-mart on the lobby level (a well stocked little store!) and they were ok after that. The carpet was bad: good thing it was brown, because it probably hid a lot. The pool was great, shower in bathroom was great, location was great! RIGHT next door to the Wyndam El San Juan hotel, which has great resturaunts and a nice casino. The Metropole and Lupi's (try the grouper finger appetizer!) are 2 great local restaurants within walking distance. Overall though, would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the ESJ Towers!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a traveler from Toronto, Canada and I've happen to stay a few times at the ESJ Towers. I can't believe how people can come up with such nasty stories against this hotel!!!! I have been there many times, and I have never had any unpleasant experience with this hotel at all. I have always gotten a clean room, a nearly spotless kitchen and a very clean and decent bathroom. I have never seen any bugs of any kind (not anywhere), and I have never seen any nails on the carpet or anything "out of order". I can't afford any expensive rooms but, I have always enjoyed a clean, comfortable, private and very safe room all the times that I have been at the ESJ Towers be myself or with my family. I'm appalled at the fact that some people can go around making making up these stories just for the pleasure of being nasty. ESJ is a good hotel and I love it!!

HotelInfo.Name: ESJ Towers
HotelInfo.Address: 6165 Isla Verde Ave., Isla Verde, Puerto Rico
